story: One day, my mom bought me a gumball from a machine. It was a bright blue gumball and it was very hard. The gumball was so hard that I could barely chew it. Even though it was hard to chew I blew the largest bubbles with it.
original_ending: I blew one bubble so big that it popped all over my face.

endings.ending: I started chewing it and chipped my front tooth.
I started chewing it and it fell out of my mouth and landed on the ground.
After I blow a bubble I've noticed a tooth was missing.
The bubble couldn't stop growing and minutes later I was flying in the sky.
I watched as the bubbles flew away with the wind.
My dog saw the bubble and jumped right at it while popping it.

story: Joey fell off the jungle gym during recess. The nurse called his mom to pick Joey up. Joey's mom brought him to the doctor. The doctor had to put a cast on Joey's broken wrist.
original_ending: The next day, Joey let his classmates sign his cast.

endings.ending: The doctor cautioned him against climbing for the next few weeks.
Joey's mom then took him for ice cream to make him feel better.
Joey never played on a jungle gym again.
He had a hard time doing school work with his other hand.
Joey got really sad about having to be in a cast.
Joey missed a few days of class due to being in a cast.

story: I took a long road trip last week. I drove four hundred miles in one day. I didn't have to but I just wanted to clear my head. I found out that I like long drives with music playing.
original_ending: It's very peaceful and I'm going to do it more.

endings.ending: Then I realized I could save a lot of money on gas by going for a bike ride instead.
I discovered a whole new genre of music that I didn't know I liked.
I met a beautiful girl on the trip and I am married to her now.
I decided to travel all around the world in my car.
Getting home I felt ready to face what the world threw at me.
Realizing how much I had paid for gas I thought that maybe I should find another way to relax.

story: Gordon had a field of goats. Every night he would lose a goat. Gordon had no idea how this was happening, until one night. He sat out and watched his goats all night until he spotted a coyote!
original_ending: He chased it off and quickly build a large fence around his goats.

endings.ending: He grabbed his rifle and killed the coyote.
He tried to scare the coyote off but it ended up chasing and biting him.
The next night he brought a shotgun with him and killed the coyote.
When he saw the coyote he started yelling and chased it off.
The coyote was badly injured and could barely limp...and was no longer a threat.
Much to his shock, the coyote attacked Gordon and he had to run for his life!

story: It was a very windy day. Jim was out walking, wearing his new hat. Suddenly the wind tore his new hat from his head! Jim chased it down, running fast, but the hat was gone.
original_ending: Jim wished he hadn't gone out in his new hat.

endings.ending: Somehow, the wind ended up blowing another hat right on top of his head!
He went to the hat store at the mall and bought the same hat because he loved it so much.
Jim decided that he would order a new hat online when he gets home.
Jim was so upset that he sat down on the curb and started crying.
He decided he would buy a new hat and take care of it better next time.
He then saw a stranger holding the had and got it back after he told the stranger what happened.

story: When I was in middle school, we played outside often. After school and on weekends, all the kids would group up together. We played all sorts of games, but one day I decided to tree climb. I climbed up the tallest tree in the neighborhood.
original_ending: I grabbed for a branch that wasn't there, and fell two stories!

endings.ending: I'd never been so high and could see all my neighborhood.
Getting scared the fire department had to be called to get me down.
All the kids saw it and started to admire me afterwards.
A teacher saw what i was doing and told me to get down immediately.
After that, it was a game to see who could climb the highest in the tree.
The view was so stunning, I forgot all about the other games and climbed the tree daily.

story: Mary made a pie for her family and one for the neighbors. After the pies were done, she put them in the window sill. After they cooled she brought them but notice one had bites in it. She looked around and couldn't find who ate it.
original_ending: Then she noticed the cat licking his paws and she laughed.

endings.ending: She forgot she had dementia and ate it herself.
She didn't know her husband took a few bites while working in the garden out back.
She had found that her son had stolen some nibbles thinking he would not get caught.
Mary could not find the culprit but assumed it might be squirrels.
She looked out the window and saw the neighborhood boys guiltily running away.
She decided to give the good one to the neighbor and serve the partially eaten pie for dessert tonight.

story: I went to a chinese restaurant after work one day. I placed my order and then waited at a table for my food. The waiter brought me my food after I waited for a while. When I looked at the food, I noticed there was a hair in it.
original_ending: I called the waiter over and he replaced the food, free of charge.

endings.ending: The waiter kindly informed me that it was not a hair, but a black bean thread.
I asked the waiter for a refund and he gladly obliged.
I began to feel sick and decided to leave.
I picked up the plate and threw it against a wall.
I took the hair out and ate my food.
I realized it was my hair and there was no issues.

story: Ted played basketball for his high school team. He stayed after practice to work on his game every day. He put in a lot of hard work. He worked especially hard on his three point shot.
original_ending: During the next game, he led all teams in scoring.

endings.ending: Surprisingly, one of his teammates (who never practiced) outplayed him the whole season.
He wound up quitting the team, though, after he met his new girlfriend who hated the sport.
Practicing so hard left Ted without enough energy for the big game.
Basketball was important to Ted but his grades started to suffer as a result.
The clock was running out and Ted took a three point shot and the crowd went wild when the shot was nothing but net.
While attempting a three pointer, Ted stumbled and broke his ankle and had to rode the bench the whole season.

story: A old man went to the diner for a cup of coffee. He sat at the bar and read his newspaper as he waited. The waiter brought over a whole pot just for the old man. The old man did not see this at first so the waiter got his attention.
original_ending: The old man drank half the pot as he finished reading.

endings.ending: The old man was grateful but only intended to drink one cup of coffee, so he did and left.
The old man was so invested in reading the newspaper he didn’t drink any coffee and it got cold.
The old man was so angry at the waiter for interrupting his reading that he threw the coffee on the floor.
The old man drank the coffee, and, because it was magical, became very young again.
The man smiled, as he appreciated the gesture.
The waiter then asked if he could bring him anything else.

story: Hannah dumped her boyfriend before she left school. While she was riding the bus home, he followed the bus with his car. In addition, he tried to drive around her when she got out of the bus. Hannah was furious and threatened him.
original_ending: As soon as she started to call the cops, he left.

endings.ending: She called her dad and he spoke to her ex-boyfriend's parents.
She reached for her pepper spray but all of a sudden he drove off.
Her boyfriend was just trying to give back her phone she left with him.
Hannah punched him in the face.
But she was also impressed with his macho attitude.
He tried to forcibly pull Hannah in his car and was beaten up by the public.

story: Ryan was at a grocery store. And he saw shelves filled with chocolate bars. He decided to buy tons of chocolate that he didn't need. But when he needed to buy food the next time, he was short on money.
original_ending: Ryan decided to only buy what he needed from then on.

endings.ending: Ryan was disgusted with himself after he had to eat nothing but chocolate bars for dinner.
After calling his around for extra money, his disappointed mom helped him pay for more groceries.
He realized that he needed to stop eating so much junk food because it costs too much.
He called his mom and asked if he could borrow some money to buy food.
Ryan felt extremely guilty and bought more chocolate bars to appease his guilt.
Ryan went home and created a strict grocery store budget, meal plan and grocery list but didnt stick to it and his mom had to buy him groceries.

story: Ana was only one year old, and she wore a tiny green swimsuit. Her mother sat In on the sand and gave her a toy shovel "Look, And," her mother said, and pointed down at the sand. Ana dug in the sand, and found that the sand would pile into shapes.
original_ending: Ana made sand shapes until it was time to leave, and she was happy.

endings.ending: Together they worked until they had built a small, simple sand castle.
She dug down so far that she found a small seashell that glimmered in the bright sun.
Ana cried when a wave came in and washed away her piles.
She squealed with delight when one scoop turned over a tiny wriggling crab.
She played with her sand for a bit then went to eat because she was hungry.
She seemed disinterested though in the sand and played with the tiny waves that washed up to her feet.

story: Katie's birthday was coming up. Her best friend wanted to surprise her with a party. She got together with Katie's friends and family and made a plan. They decided to have Katie go to the store while they set up the party.
original_ending: They set up the party and surprised Katie when she came back.

endings.ending: When Katie came back she had a lot of party stuff in her bags as one of her friends had told her about the secret party.
Katie screamed with joy when she saw all her family and friends gathered together and started jumping up and down.
However, Katie met a guy at the store, and decided to spend the rest of the day with him and she missed the party.
When Katie got back they had already finished all the wine and so she had to go back to the store.
A friend went with her so she could signal when they were on their way back.
Once she was gone, everyone scrambled to get it all set up and ready.

story: Dudley was a pioneer in America, long ago. One day, he had to make a journey through a forest. While walking through the forest, he came upon a brown bear. He then noticed that the bear was with some tiny cubs.
original_ending: The bear charged Dudley, and he ran for his life.

endings.ending: He saw that they looked hungry so he left his sandwich for the bears.
The cubs were playing and minding their own business so Dudley creeped away quietly.
Dudley waited for the momma bear to leave, and he took one of the cubs.
Dudley realized this was a dangerous situation and quietly watched from afar.
Dudley snuck off so not to disturbed the bear and the cubs.
Dudley crouched down and watched the bear and the cubs disappear into the forest.

story: Everyday Rob had to walk to school. But he decided that riding a bike to school would be better. He saved up money for a new bike. And he was able to bike to school quickly.
original_ending: And his new bike gave him freedom to go where to he wanted.

endings.ending: Rob took his bike to the mall where it was stolen while he was shopping.
Rob repainted his bike green cause green was his favourite color.
This also let him get a little extra sleep in the morning.
He also started to get interested in cycling competitions.
After a few weeks, his bike started to break down.
Many of his friends joined him on his morning bike rides.

story: Gina's family had gone out of town for a funeral. The funeral was now over. Gina's mom needed to stay and plan to move her mom to MN. Her dad couldn't miss anymore work.
original_ending: They stood on the porch waving goodbye as he drove back home.

endings.ending: Gina's mom convinced her dad to quit his job and stay in MN.
Gina's dad called his job to see if he could take an extended break due to the funeral, they were understanding.
Or thats what they thought, but actually he was going to visit the entire other family he kept stashed in another state.
Once he left, she and her mom boarded a spaceship that took them to Jupiter for a little vacation.
Her dad quit his job to help get everything planned for the move.
Gina stayed behind and did all of the moving work.

story: We bought a kitten for my daughter. For weeks I tried to teach her to use the litter box. Instead the cat liked to pee in the laundry pile. I switched the laundry pile with the litter box.
original_ending: The next day she peed in the litter box three times.

endings.ending: To my surprise, the kitten continued peeing in the laundry pile regardless of where it was.
The kitten approached me and thanked me for moving the litter box, for she liked the new location much better.
That didn't help either and now all our clothes are yellow.
Then she peed all over the kitchen.
When I went to put the laundry in the washer, cat litter fell out everywhere and I realized my plan had an unintended consequence.
I had hoped that this would motivate the cat to use the litter box but instead it just found a new pile of laundry to use as it's toilet.

story: Mike always loved to go fishing. One day, he went to the lake and set his gear up. He waited patiently for a fish to nibble his line. He finally felt a tug and snapped his fishing pole to hook the fish!
original_ending: He was so excited to show his friends his catch!

endings.ending: Mike realized that it was a fish he didn't know, his friends then told him that it was a rare fish.
Mike just took a picture with the fish to show his friends and then returned it to the water.
The fish was too big and snatched the fishing pole out of Mike's hands.
Mike reeled in the line but only caught a turtle.
He reeled in what felt like a huge fish but gasped in horror when he realized he had caught a snake.
The fish took off so fast that it was jerked out of mikes hand and he lost he favorite fishing pole

story: Tim and Jessica went outside to play a game of hide and seek. Jessica found a great place to hide in a cave by a tree. After ten minutes, she heard leaves moving and knew Tim was near. She didn't move an inch, and all of a sudden, Tim found the cave!
original_ending: Then Tim went to hide and Jessica went to seek.

endings.ending: He looked into the cave, but because it was so dark he didn't see Jessica and left.
Then before she could realize it, Tim kissed her flush on the lips.
A glimmer caught Jessica's eye, and she and Tim both discovered that the cave was filled with gemstones.
When it was Tim's turn to hide, Jessica couldn't find him for over an hour and she finally gave up and went inside for dinner.
They both laughed and then Tim said, "my turn!"
"Gotcha!" he said as he ran off to find his own hiding spot.

story: One Halloween, Gray was playing a game to find candy. He looked all through a pile of hay to find hidden pieces of candy. When he found the candy, he put it in his bucket. Gray thought it was more fun to find the candy than to keep it.
original_ending: At the end of the game, Gray had no candy because he would put it back

endings.ending: Gray ended up finding more than his candy as the others left theirs too.
He could not find his candy and got fed up and left .
He gave most of his candy to his friends because he just wanted to keep searching.
However, he still kept all of the candy he found and ate way too much sugar for the following month.
So he gave all of his caandy to his mother and asked her to hide them again.
But, he still enjoyed eating it when he got home.

story: Two weeks ago my wife's nephew came by to visit. He brought his wife and one year old boy. The little boy played with our granddaughter's toys. We made coffee and talked for an hour.
original_ending: We were glad to see them as they do not visit often.

endings.ending: The boy was happy playing by himself as we talked.
I was sad to see them leave.
We made plans to go on a family vacation soon.
After coffee, we got dessert at a nearby cafe.
The little boy ended up breaking one of the toys.
The little boy was playing with a walker toy and ended up taking his very first steps.

story: Ike often liked to take walks alone. During one walk, he heard a cry come from the inside of an alley. Ike went to investigate and saw a small cat. He gave it some dried fish and pet it as it purred.
original_ending: Now, sometimes on his walks, the cat follows Ike around.

endings.ending: It turned out to be a "fairy catmother," and gave him any three wishes he wanted.
Then it turned into a saber-toothed cat and nearly got him before he got away.
The cat became very ill after eating the dried fish and later died.
The cat bit Ike's finger because it hates being touched by humans.
He took the cat home with him.
Suddenly the cat changed into a beautiful girl.

story: Steve wanted to go for a job but his shorts didn't have pockets. He had to wear his mother's purse to hold his phone and keys. A policeman saw Steve and thought he stole the purse. This caused Steve to run faster than he ever did before.
original_ending: Steve thought he was being tailed by the fashion police.

endings.ending: While running, Steve falls into a hole full of cops who are on a lunch break.
Because the policeman can't catch up with him he starts crying.
He rounded the corner and got tackled to the ground
Someone else ran past him as he was running and stole the purse from him.
He was beginning to be late for his job.
The policeman yelled "stop there boy!".

story: Lindsay had a day off and wanted to go to the park. Arriving at the park she noticed a large amount of ducks. Running over to them, they all ran away except for one. This one duck followed Lindsay around the pond for an hour.
original_ending: When leaving, Lindsay reached down to pet the duck, who bit her.

endings.ending: She decided she would take it home and keep it as a pet.
She took some break out of her lunch and fed it to the duck.
Lindsay then pulled out some crumbs from her lunch box that she had brought to the park, and fed the duck that was following her.
Lindsay then pulled out her camera and took pictures of the duck, which she then posted online on her social media page.
Lindsay fed the duck part of her bread from her lunch.
The duck followed her home.

story: John saw a hurt man on the side of the road. He didn't know whether to stop and help or keep going. John felt he should help the man so he did. John put him in his car and took him to the hospital.
original_ending: The man was grateful and even gave John a reward.

endings.ending: He later learned the man sadly passed away at the hospital.
After talking to the man, they discovered a common interest and became good friends.
The man was so injured he died shortly after arriving at the hospital.
John had a flat tire on the way to the hospital and carried the man the rest of the way.
On their way to the hospital John looked at the man and started to think maybe the man had bad intentions.
The man was bleeding so much that he almost didn't make it.

story: Joey sat by a pond holding a sandwich. His phone rang and he put his sandwich on a rock to answer. He talked for five minutes with a dear friend. When he disconnected, the sandwich was gone.
original_ending: After looking around him, he finally saw it at the bottom of the pond.

endings.ending: He looked up and and noticed a squirrel had stolen it and climbed up a tree.
He over and saw that his sandwich had been blown away by the wind.
He noticed a duck in the pond with his sandwich in its beak.
He got startled when he saw a bear cub walking back with his sandwich.
His friend had hidden it to prank him and returned it in a few minutes.
Joey was so engrossed in the conversation that he didn't remember eating it all up.

story: Zach's favorite football team had a big game coming up. After a few drinks he decided he was going to bet money on the game. Zach bet a lot of money because he was sure they were going to win. Instead, Zach's team lost the game.
original_ending: He was upset he was out of a lot of money.

endings.ending: He felt frustrated and didn't know what to tell his parents.
He vowed to himself that he will never bet on sports again.
Zach realized he would probably have to live with his parents again after that, and the thought filled him with dread.

As it was, the problem was not just that Zach lost a lot of money on that bet, but that it was not his money he lost,  but rather money from the store where he worked that he was supposed to bring to the bank.
Zach immediately called to complain at the team's headquarters office number he found online.
Without a victory, Zach knew he would be getting a lot of teasing from his coworkers the following week.

story: Gina was able to move into her brother's old room. Gina had been sharing a room with 2 other girls her whole life. Getting her own room was a dream come true. She didn't even move her bed.
original_ending: She was so happy she didn't care if she slept on the floor.

endings.ending: She felt she was finally able to become her own person as opposed to just being one of the girls and talking about boys all night long.
Even though she left the bed in its original spot, she did paint all the walls black though, and installed a black light on the ceiling.
Unfortunately, her brother had to move back in since college did not work out for him and she was forced to share rooms again.
The floor was very dirty, so she didn't want to sleep on it and got a new bed.
She couldn't wait to enjoy her own, private space.
Gina had lots of plans on how she would decorate her new room.

story: Lila was sad because she had no friends. She tried to make friends, but she was too shy. One day at the park Lila saw some kids playing. One of the kids saw Lila looking at them and asked her to play too.
original_ending: Now Lila goes to the park every weekend to play with her new friends.

endings.ending: The kid then said it was a joke and ran away from Lilith.
Lilith didn't like their games and decided to quit playing with them shortly after.
Lila soon realized that her new friends were all from different countries, which thrilled her because it was much more interesting than playing with the boring kids from her neighborhood.
The kids taught Lila how to play a new game that day and she eventually became so good at it that she qualified for national championships.
Lila played with kids in the parked until dark all summer.
Lila was so happy that kids were playing with her, she inviting them all to her birthday party the next month.

story: JJ got in the car when Daddy said it was time to go. Daddy drove to a big building, and took JJ to a room where Mommy was. In Mommy's arms, there was a tiny baby, and JJ was very confused. "Come here," Mommy said, and JJ climbed onto the bed.
original_ending: "This is your sister, her name is Ana," Mommy said, and JJ was happy.

endings.ending: Mommy told JJ that they had adopted a baby and the new baby would be his brother.
Mommy announced to JJ that she had given birth, but decided to give the baby up for adoption.
The baby started convulsing violently, and Mommy screamed for a doctor nearby to come and help.
JJ looked at the baby and felt a rage of anger, and pouted in front of Mommy to show his disapproval.
JJ acted happy but she was a little jealous inside.
JJ accidentally slip and made a fool of herself in front of her new baby brother.

story: Each night, Joan's tiny dog ran to her bedside. Joan placed a stool so the dog could jump on the bed. Suddenly, Joan's dog stopped coming into the bed at night. When Joan turned on a light to see what was wrong, the dog came.
original_ending: Joan had to put a night light next to the dog's stool.

endings.ending: It was at this point that Joan realized that her dog might need to be taken to the veterinarian for an eye evaluation.
The dog's eyes glowed red, and Joan became afraid -- it looked like her dog was possessed!
That day after Joan began sleeping with her lights on a night.
Joan's dog began sleeping in her brother's room who had recently bought a night light the other day.
The dog had been eating one of her favorite boots.
The dog had a mouse in its mouth that it dropped in the bed.

story: John went to the furniture store to pick out a nice chair. He looked for one that swiveled as well had rolled. The sales assistant helped him find one. The chair cost John only seventy five dollars.
original_ending: John was glad that there was an IKEA nearby him.

endings.ending: The next day as he sat down in the chair it broke into pieces.
He thought that since it was a great price he may as well buy a sofa and entertainment center too.
But John didn't have the money, so he went home feeling a bit bad to not have a job.
Since the chair was a bit cheap, John also bought a table a few chairs to go with it.
He was really pleased that the chair had been on sale and was under his budget.
When he got home he immediately put it together and was very pleased with the purchase.

story: Wendy loved to cook, but had no money. Her friends encouraged her to make a living out of her cooking. Wendy tried baking some goods, and selling them one day. Wendy made so much money, she was able to pay her bills.
original_ending: Nowadays, Wendy does what she loves, and also pays her way cooking.

endings.ending: But Wendy lost interest in cooking soon and the business went bankrupt.
She sold her business for a lot of money and has happily retired.
She invested that money into a the space program and now they sell her cupcakes in the first bakery in Mars.
She then went back to school for what she'd always wanted to do: be a professional tuba player.
However, needing to cook to pay the bills took the joy out of cooking, and Wendy stopped cooking professionally.
Wendy's cooking success was brought to the attention of a business investor who helped Wendy create a business franchise for her food.

story: Ray gathered his friends to tell them a funny joke he heard. He started to tell the joke and realized he forgot how it ended. Ray tried to make up his own punchline to save his joke. All of his friends were confused and did not laugh.
original_ending: Ray tried to blame the friends for having no sense of humor.

endings.ending: Ray apologized and told his friends he would take them out for a drink instead, and everyone was excited.
Ray shuffled off in shame and was too embarrassed to call any of his friends for weeks.
Ray felt embarrassed and decided not to tell any more jokes while listening to what his friends had to say.
He got very angry and left his friends, going home to watch some of his favorite shows.
So Ray explained the joke in great detail which didn't make it at all funnier but it made his friends laugh at the attempt to save the joke.
But once he tried to act out the joke by slipping into all of the roles in the joke he had them dying on floor from laughing.

story: Timmy was told many times not to play ball in the house. Today he didn't listen and played with his basketball inside. The ball hit his mom's favorite vase. His mom found out and wanted to know who broke it.
original_ending: Since no one would admit it, the family vacation was cancelled.

endings.ending: Timmy decided to do the right thing and confess even though he knew his mother would be angry with him.
Timmy blamed his brother and snickered while his brother was being punished and he got to play.
Timmy admitted to it, and was grounded for a week.
Timmy blamed ghosts, so his mother hired an exorcist.
Timmy's dad took the blame and Timmy went unpunished.
Timmy blamed the cat and his mom listened to him, so the cat was sold.

story: Darrel was waiting in the drive through for half an hour. He had about lost his patience. When he finally got to the window he was about to scream at them. They immediately apologized before he could.
original_ending: They had an accident and offered free food to make it up to him.

endings.ending: But when the drive through told him they were out of food, Darrel really did scream.
Which was for the best, because he suddenly realized he had no money to pay for the food and he had to leave.
They were so incompetent that they ended up mixing up his order anyway!
They quickly gave him his food and informed him that there were very few employees working that day.
He chose not to accept the apology and asked to speak to the manager.
Before he could open his mouth, his engine started smoking and he had to call a tow truck.

story: Ug is a dog who belongs to Bob. Ug likes to sunbathe every day. Ug moves around the room following the sun each morning. He likes to lay on the front porch in the sun in the afternoon.
original_ending: Bob knows his dog is silly and it makes him love him even more!

endings.ending: When it is not sunny Ug likes to lay next to the brightest light in the house.
While sunbathing one day Ug saw another dog walk by and instantly became intrigued by her.
On rainy days, Ug likes to use the sun tanning lamp in Bob's mom's bedroom.
Recently, Bob decided to take Ug to the beach since Ug loves the sun, and discovered that walking a cute dog is an excellent way to attract girls.
In the evening Ug jumps up and goes to sleep on Bob's bed.
But when it's dinnertime, you can always find Ug happily eating from his dog bowl in the kitchen.

story: Sarah was waiting in line to try out for her school's singing club. She thought everyone there was terrible at singing. So she she thought getting in would be easy. After her audition, she was shocked when she wasn't accepted.
original_ending: Sarah believed the whole thing was set up to humiliate her.

endings.ending: Sarah took her rejection as motivation and decided to train harder for the next audition.
Sarah was disappointed in herself and cried to her best friends and dog.
Later, Sarah found out that the president of the club was jealous of her talents so she had intentionally sabotaged her chances to join the club.
Sarah confronted the club members and told them all they were terrible singers, and she was suspended from school for being rude.
She decided to face reality and join the marching band instead as she did love music.
She later found out that the judge who heard her sing had always hated her.

story: The chicken was entirely too spicy that they bought for dinner. They tried to eat the chicken anyway. They needed a lot of drink, because of how spicy the chicken was. After eating the chicken they both had a stomachache.
original_ending: Because of the stomachaches they decided never to eat spicey again.

endings.ending: They had to go to the toilet multiple times throughout the evening.
After the stomachache they threw up all the chicken.
They had to go to the pharmacy for some medicine to ease the discomfort.
After a while, the pain eased up.
Despite this, they did not learn their lesson and got the same dish a few weeks later.
Next time they made it they used much less spice in its preparation.

story: Each year, Amy's mom ordered winter coats from a catalog. When the coats arrived, Amy fell in love with one trimmed in fur. But Amy's mom handed it to her sister. She gave Amy a pink coat that felt like plastic.
original_ending: Amy left the coat on the playground the next day.

endings.ending: Amy tried to trade coats with her sister, but her sister said no.
Amy cried until her mother ordered her a fur coat as well.
Amy refused to accept the pink coat and demanded fur coat.
Amy accepted the pink coat because it was her mom's choice.
Amy stole the fur-trimmed from her sister.
Amy threw a fit and refused to wear the pink coat.

story: Tara used to live next to the beach as a kid. She now lived no where near the beach. She drove a hour to get to the beach every weekend. She decided to move closer to the beach.
original_ending: She now only drive 5 minutes to get to the beach.

endings.ending: She bought a new house near the beach.
But she had to postpone her plans because she lost her job.
Unfortunately, the price of beach housing skyrocketed since she last moved, and Tara was forced to find a roommate.
On her way to look at beach properties, a semitruck T-boned the vehicle she was in, injuring Tara and sending her to the hospital.
But the tsunami warning made her fearful and she decided to remain in her old house.
She hates the beach now because of the noise.

story: Amy had been ignoring Ray in class for a week. She hoped this would encourage him to call her. Night after night the phone didn't ring. Amy sat in class sad to have lost his friendship.
original_ending: After class she started to speak, but he walked away quickly.

endings.ending: Amy eventually decided to take the initiative and called Ray to salvage their friendship.
Amy approached Ray in class to talk, but Ray shut her down quickly, telling Amy he didn't want to participate in her mind games.
Amy talked to Ray after class and apologized, to which Ray decided to give her another chance.
Amy joined a club and met some new friends.
Amy decided to change her tactics and smiled at Ray so to encourage him
Amy wanted to cry but she looked up and saw Ray smiling at her.

story: I fell in love with the man of my dreams. He traveled all over the world with his job. I loved to travel with him every chance I got. We fell deeper in love and grew very close to each other.
original_ending: To this day we are madly in love and together often.

endings.ending: Soon the travelling will end and we will settled down together in one place.
Later I could not travel and he continued, so we had to part.
One day, I found out that he was having an affair with a woman in Thailand, so my heart was broken.
We wound up having seven children together and moving to an island far out in the Pacific.
Unfortunately, he cheated and now I'm all alone.
Sadly, he got very sick and now I'm a widow.

story: Gina was in a bad mood when she got to her desk. A new boy on the bus had taken the seat next to her. And he waited until the bus was empty to get off. As a result Gina had no time to eat breakfast in the lunch room.
original_ending: She hadn't eaten at home and now would be hungry until lunch.

endings.ending: She was so hungry when she arrived home she ate a whole pizza.
Her appetite was cut and did not eat anything for the rest of the day.
Luckily for her, Jhon had brought sandwiches to everyone in the place, so she could eat.
Ginny didn't eat the entire time, causing a headache.
Telling her teacher, she was allowed to eat something in class.
At lunch she was so hungry she had servings.

story: Nancy thought her hair made her look ugly. She decided to go to a beauty shop for a new hair style. While she was there, she noticed a girl being cruel to her brother. Nancy's new hair style turned out great.
original_ending: Yet, Nancy learned the way you treat others is what makes you pretty.

endings.ending: She told the hair stylist to give the girl a terrible hair cut since she was being so mean to her brother.
She went to the girl and told her that she was actually her Fairy Godmother and would have given her three wishes, but since she saw her being so mean, she wasn't going to get the wishes anymore.
After her appointment was complete, Nancy scolded the rude girl for being mean.
Unfortunately, the cruel girl tossed a wad of chewing gum which got stuck into Nancy's hair.
She forgot all about her brother and came back home alone.
She had enough confidence to confront the cruel girl and protected her brother.

story: Tommy got out of the car and walked to the water's edge. His dad came over and put a piece of bait on his hook. Tommy cast his line into the water and smiled at his dad. A few minutes later he felt a tug on his line.
original_ending: He pulled out a fat catfish from the water as his dad smiled on.

endings.ending: He pulled out his line and laughed when he saw a rag doll on his hook.
He tried to reel it in but could not and so had to ask his dad for help.
Tommy had gotten his line stuck on a tree branch.
Tommy's dad excitedly screamed at Tommy getting his first catch.
Tommy reeled in an alligator gar, which was inedible.
Tommy's catch was so heavy he could not reel it in and had to let it go.

story: Before I took the SAT I was a little nervous. So the night before I went out and bought a Butterfinger bar. They break really easily so I tried to keep it safe. I put it in a special place at night and protected it in the car.
original_ending: I was so concerned about the bar that I wasn't worried about the SAT!

endings.ending: The next morning, I discovered someone had eaten my Butterfinger and left the wrapper in the car.
Eating a candy bar always helps me focus while taking the test.
My mind returning to the test I forgot and left it in the car when I climbed out.
It became my lucky test mascot and I never did open and eat it.
After I took the SAT, I wanted to eat the butterfinger bar but it melted in my car.
I ate the butterfinger bar just before taking the SAT and I felt better and ready to go.

story: My family and I went to Six Flags over the summer. My brother and I decided to go on the scariest roller coaster ever! We were both so nervous. We got on the ride and screamed the whole way.
original_ending: In the end, we had a lot of fun and wanted to go on again!

endings.ending: We decided to never set foot in a roller coaster again.
Six Flags had to abandon their roller coasters because it caused anxiety.
My brother passed out on the roller coaster which made me joke about it throughout the whole trip!
I've screamed so much that I ended up losing my voice.
It was a day that I will never forget!
My mom took a picture of us and we look so terrified.

story: Suzie tried to squeeze into her Halloween costume. She'd worn it last year and it fit perfectly then. Suzie started to cry when she couldn't get it to fit now. Her mother got out her sewing machine and made changes to it.
original_ending: Suzie hugged her mom and went out trick-or-treating in her costume.

endings.ending: Suzie went on a diet and was able to fit in the costume after a few weeks.
Suzie's mom ruined the costume trying to fix it and just bought a new one.
Susie’s mother waved a magic wand and made Susie skinnier so they didn’t have to alter the costume.
Susie’s mothers sewing machine was broke and Susie was very upset but it was for the best because several children got bad candy that night resulting in food poisoning
Suzie did not like how it looked now, so she went out to get a new costume.
Suzie was not appreciating what her mother did, so she was grounded and could not go trick-or-treating.

story: Cody was excited but sad because his parents said they were moving. He was going to miss his friends and might not make new ones. His family moved an hour away to a very small town. Cody found that in such a small town people were really nice.
original_ending: He made a lot of good friends and still lives there to this day.

endings.ending: But he didn't socialise and became a recluse.
But he ran away from home and went back to the older place.
His new school was so much better than the old one and Cody soon found he had tons of friends.
He was really excited to try out for all of the sports teams and learn to play football.
He still had a hard time making any close friends, and he has remained extremely lonely since he moved.
Unfortunately, soon after his parents said they had to move again and Cody had to start all over making friends.

story: One time, my friend showed me his really cool telescope. We looked at planets and stars at night. I saw him a few days later and asked if I could look through it again. He told me that he sold it to a friend.
original_ending: I was disappointed, but I found out my parents bought it for me.

endings.ending: I decided to give up on the hobby and never gave a second thought to telescopes again.
Without a telescope to look through, I felt cut off from the stars with no way to truly take in the wonderful details the telescopes offered.
I found out that he had lied about it and never spoke to him again.
I worked hard all summer mowing lawns after that so I could buy my own telescope.
Now, I can look at the stars whenever I wanted.
I began to work and put away money so I could buy my own telescope.

story: Cheyenne was home from her vacation and she was tired. She slept until noon and then took a long shower. For the rest of the day she just laid around the house being lazy. Cheyenne's mom decided to give her a couple days to rest.
original_ending: However, after that there would be no more sitting around the house.

endings.ending: Soon after, she found her dream job so her rest paid off!
She decided that she didn't want her mom deciding when she could rest so she ran away from home.
Then Cheyenne and her mom were to clean the entire house while jamming out to music.
Then Cheyenne ended up getting sick and needed more time to rest.
But after seeing Chayenne layzing around the house, Chayenne's mom decided to put her to work and asked her to do a few chores.
Chayenne got really bored of doing nothing and decided that was time to work out and get fit.

story: Parker had just made a grilled cheese sandwich. Just as he was about to eat it, he got a phone call. He went to the other room to talk. When he came back, his sandwich was gone.
original_ending: He looked around and saw his cat eating his it.

endings.ending: He looked around and saw his little daughter running away with his sandwich screaming,"it's all mine now".
He just wished the seller had told him that this particular alien was so fond of constantly stealing his human food.
He found it on the floor, it turns out he dropped it as he was leaving
He looked around for it for maybe five minutes before realising it was in his hand the whole time.
A homeless man had took it but Parker couldn't be mad about it.
Parker looked around and he could see a dog running away with his sandwich on his mouth.

story: Gina's family had been out of town for weeks. Now they were back home, and Gina wanted to go to school. She ran in the house and freshened up. She headed to the bus stop and waited with the other kids.
original_ending: She had been gone so kids looked at her as if they had seen a ghost.

endings.ending: The other kids kept staring at her as she still had toothpaste on her face.
The other kids greeted her and said how much they missed her.
None of the kids remembered Gina.
They were ecstatic when they saw Gina.
Everyone was so happy to see Gina!
Her friends decided to play a trick on her and pretended they didn't even see her.

story: Mary was a toddler. She was playing in the living room when her dog jumped on her. The dog began biting her ear and Mary cried out. Mary's mom came running in and pulled the dog away.
original_ending: They had to have someone come take the dog away.

endings.ending: Mary's mom inspected the bite for severity.
Mary's mom put the dog in the other room.
It turned out Mary had food behind her ear and the dog was just trying to lick it off so everyone laughed.
They sent the dog to discipline school and he became a wonderful family pet
They had to put up barriers to keep Mary and the dog separate after that.
Unfortunately, Mary developed a fear of dogs for the rest of her life.

story: Jake and Dan saw a Power Wheels commercial on TV. They were at Jake's house. Jake ran and asked his mother if he could have one,. His mother laughed and said she would think about it.
original_ending: Dan decided he would ask his mom as soon as he got home.

endings.ending: If Jake was going to get one then maybe Dan thought he could also play with it.
Dan saw how expensive it was and gave up the idea of owning one.
Dan on the other hand, did not really like to play with Power Wheels much.
Dan told Jake that he could also play with his at his house if he wanted.
Jake's mom knew she would not buy the Power Wheel because she thought it was too dangerous.
Jake ran back to Dan and told him that his mom is going to buy him a Power Wheel.

story: When I was 15, I was very disrespectful. I said an adult word while speaking to my father. He grounded me and took away my car keys. I sulked for days because I couldn't leave the house.
original_ending: I eventually stole my keys and went to see my friends anyway.

endings.ending: One night I tried to sneak out my window, but I fell and broke my arm.
I learned to never speak that way to my father again.
I learned to never speak this way in front of my father again.
Even though he did not unground me I apologized.
I didn't understand why he was angry, as I'd heard him say the word often.
Having no car keys made me be a lot more careful about what I said in the future.

story: Jody kept a pet deer in her barn. The deer kept growing bigger and bigger. Jody knew she would have to let it free. She took the deer into the woods and let it go.
original_ending: Suddenly she heard a shot and the deer fell to the ground.

endings.ending: She waved goodbye and was proud of herself for letting the deer go.
However the deer was fond of her and didn't run off into the woods.
To Jody's surprise, the deer turned to her and told her that it wanted to stay with her and be her pet.
Jody never saw the deer again even though she returned to the forest many times to search for it.
The deer bounded off galloping through the woods.
The deer turned around and went back to the barn to lay down.

story: Fred went backpacking in the mountains for the weekend. Every night he hung the bag of food in a tree for bear proofing. One night he forgot to remove a candy bar from his backpack. A bear came during the night and tore apart Fred's backpack.
original_ending: He had to carry his gear in his sleeping bag for the rest of the trip.

endings.ending: Fred decided to end his camping trip early and go home.
Fred left anything he could and carried only the necessities and went on with his trip.
Luckily, Fred had a second sack he brought in case and was able to carry his stuff in it.
Fred, afraid about future encounters with wildlife, decided to end the camping trip prematurely.
He had to immediately cancel his trip and return because he had no gear.
He was glad he had extra food secured somewhere a bear could not get.

story: Jeff was on his way to visit a friend in another state. Halfway there, he got lost. He couldn't figure out his location on any of his maps. He had to pull into a gas station and shamefacedly ask directions.
original_ending: Jeff found that he'd wandered 75 miles out of his way!

endings.ending: They were very rude and told him to leave if he wasn't buying anything.
He went inside but could find no one inside at all.
The man in the gas station told him that he was only 10 minutes away and he was on the right track.
The man in the gas station seemed creepy so Jeff left right away.
The gas station attendant was helpful in providing useful directions.
No one at the station knew how to help get Jeff to his destination so Jeff had to find another place to ask for directions.

story: My teeth have been hurting all of a sudden out of nowhere. I booked an emergency dentist appointment right away. The dentist asked when the last time I flossed was. I honestly couldn't remember but I know I don't floss often.
original_ending: The dentist told me I have gum disease and need to start flossing.

endings.ending: The dentist gave me a annoying look and gave me a pack of dental floss.
The dentist called in the assistant to clean and floss my teeth.
The dentist said I need to undergo a emergency dental procedure as soon as possible.
My dentist informed me to start flossing more often and to come back for a follow up visit in two weeks.
I don't even own floss.
I don't think I have flossed since my last dental visit.

story: We had my oldest nephew sleep over at our house. He packed up all his clothes, and brought some books. We went swimming in the pool and then got ice cream. After dinner we made a fire and had s'mores.
original_ending: It was a great time, I hope we can do it again.

endings.ending: Then we decided to sleep next to the fire under the stars.
My nephew ate too much chocolate and got sick.
One of the s'mores melted and burned my right thumb.
I chose not to do this again for a long while, though, as it was just too exhausting for me to do.
When we went to go to sleep, he started crying about how he missed his mom and had to go home.
One of my nephew's marshmallows caught on fire and stuck to his leg when he swung the stick around trying to put it out, so we had to go to the hospital.

story: My three year old son and I decided to mow the lawn. We checked the oil and filled the gas tank. He sat on my lap and played his Ipod while I drove. I noticed he had stopped playing after a few minutes.
original_ending: I looked down and he was sound asleep in my lap.

endings.ending: He was looking at the puppy next door, who happened to be passing by.
He got scared of the loud sound, and wanted to get off the mower shorty after.
It appears he had dropped his Ipod when I was making sharp turn.
I stopped the mower and realized he was picking grass out of his mouth.
When I looked down he was no where to be found, luckily my husband had picked up him and taken him inside to take a nap.
Without any sound coming from my son, I looked down to find he was staring at a round object in the sky.

story: Marcy needed to pick up her dog some food at the pet store. She had her daughter with her. Getting through the pet store with only food is hard. After almost an hour, they made it to the car.
original_ending: Marcy was the proud owner of a bag of dog food and a new puppy.

endings.ending: They realized a cute cat followed them back from the pet store.
Marcy forgot her wallet in the pet store.
Marcy checked her pockets and realized she didn't have her keys.
Marcy felt guilty about leaving her dog in the car on such a hot day.
Somehow a bird had dive bombed into her windshield and she realized the irony of a bird dying in a pet store parking lot.
Once she got out of the store, Marcy began fumbling with her keys only to find the missing $50 dollar bill she had lost in her pocket.

story: Tony lived in Kansas. His parents called to tell him there was a tornado warning. Tony had two fears, spiders and tornados. He went into the cellar just in case it hit near him.
original_ending: The cellar was filled with spiders but he stayed and luckily survived.

endings.ending: Luckily, the tornado passed by and he was able to come out quickly.
Fortunately, the cellar had recently been cleaned, so there were no spiders.
The tornado blew by the house ripping to roof of the house but they were not injured.
The tornado died down and they hit in the cellar for nothing.
It's a good thing he went in the cellar because a tornado did come though his neighborhood, destroying his home.
Natural disasters and insects were the least of Tony's problems after he discovered a natural gas leak as he was hiding in the basement.

story: Last year, me and my friends took a road trip. We were going from Alabama all the way to North Carolina. To get to North Carolina we had to drive through Tennessee. We got to drive all through the mountains for twelve hours.
original_ending: After an exhausting trip, we finally made it to our hotel.

endings.ending: This one one of the most scenic drives we have ever experienced.
We are planning a West Coast road trip for this year.
It had been the most scenic trip that I have ever taken.
My friends and I agreed that we will never drive that long ever again!
We never made it in time, though, as our car broke down on the way over there.
Throughout the mountains, we saw several species of wildlife that we had never imagined that we would ever see!

story: I was still full from Thanksgiving but could not wait. I went to the shed and got my Christmas tree and decorations. I set up the tree in front of my front room windows. I then spent hours putting decorations on the tree.
original_ending: I stood back and was proud of my beautiful Christmas tree.

endings.ending: I then went outside and put up all our outdoor Christmas decorations as well.
I felt very excited for the Christmas season when I was all done decorating.
I realized that I was missing the star at the top.
The tree appears to be a lot older, and it is not as lively as it was before.
When I plugged in the tree, I realized none of the lights worked.
Once I stepped away, my dogs immediately began pulling the ornaments off of the tree.

story: Kim loves to vacation at the beach every year. It has been several years since her last beach trip. She is always tracking sound around everywhere. Even to this day her car has sand everywhere in it.
original_ending: Kim thinks of it as always having the beach close to her.

endings.ending: The sand got so bad that she had to vacuum out her car and get it professionally cleaned.
Kim also collected a bunch of seashells and glued them to her car since she loves the beach so much.
Kim decides to get her car vacuumed.
Kim decides she is going to visit the beach this summer.
No one likes riding in her car as you always get sand in your shoes.
She just put the car up for sale, she'll have to vacuum it up now.

story: The zipper on Laura's jeans broke a few weeks ago. We weren't sure where to get it fixed so I looked around. We found a good place and ended up going there. The fix was very cheap and we picked it up the next day.
original_ending: Her new zipper was a lot better than the other one and she loved it!

endings.ending: Unfortunately, the work was also cheap and Laura’s zipper broke while she giving big presentation at work for her bosses.
Laura ended up zipping her finger in the new zipper and the blood ruined her jeans.
The fix was of poor quality and the zipper broke again after a few days.
The zipper did not match the other metal parts on the jeans so Laura donated her jeans to a clothing drive.
A week later it broke again!
When a button on Laura's jacket came off a week later we took it to the same place.

story: The trip I took for my graduation was exciting, fun, and a life lesson. I went to so many exciting cities and ate lots of different food. I got lost in downtown San Diego, but ended up at the beach. I met the man I call my husband at that beach.
original_ending: I loved my trip to California and want to live there one day.

endings.ending: But soon after I've realized he was a married man.
But then I've found out the man I call my husband was actually a hitman.
When I’m mad at him I swear I will never go anywhere again without a map and gps.
I thank God everyday for my horrible sense of direction and bringing this wonderful man into my life.
It was fun visiting California but I would never want to live there.
We got married on the same beach that I met him on.

story: Fred put in his headphones and listened to music. He sang along to the music as he went about his day. A person on the street stopped Fred to ask about his singing. He wanted to know what song he was singing to.
original_ending: Fred sang the name of the song to the man and walked on.

endings.ending: The person further explained that he was from another planet where they were studying human music, which freaked Frank out so badly that he fainted.
Frank was annoyed by the interruption, so he ignored the person and continued singing.
Fred ignored the man and continued on his day.
Fred said "Ocean Eyes".
Fred was too embarrassed to reveal which song he was listening to and mentioned a different song to the man.
Fred was skeptical of the stranger and walked away without saying anything.

story: Cade is excited about his Christmas show. He has been practicing Jingle Bells all week. On the day of the show he is so nervous. On stage he looks out at the audience to find his mom.
original_ending: She is in the first row, so now he knows everything will be fine.

endings.ending: The show was about to start but he could not find her any where.
Suddenly he gets a call from his mom saying she couldn't make it and his aunt would go in her place.
Unfortunately she was outside having a cigarette and Cade felt an overwhelming fear that led him to run off the stage without performing.
His heart sank as he saw his mother passionately kissing a strange man Cade had never seen before.
With a sudden rush of stage fright, he crumbled in fear, and he never went onto the stage.
He entered onto the stage, but he received a bad reaction from the crowd.

story: Mary was driving on the highway in her car. She saw a man standing next to his car on the side of the road. She pulled over and he told her he has a flat tire. He told Mary that he doesn't know how to change a tire himself.
original_ending: Mary changed the tire and fought him how for next time.

endings.ending: Mary told the man that she didn't know either, but that she could call roadside assistance for him.
Mary laughed at the man's ignorance and got back in her car and drove away.
She didn't know either but she called AAA
She has some experience so they worked together to get the new tire on.
He further explained that this was because he was from another planet and this was his first time driving a car, so Mary quickly fled in fear.
Mary told him she didn't know how to change a tire either, so she was unable to help.

story: I wanted to see a new movie that was coming out. I went to the theaters on the opening day. To my surprise, it was not packed. I bought a ticket and some snacks and went inside.
original_ending: I sat down at a good seat and enjoyed the whole movie.

endings.ending: I was able to get a seat in my favorite place.
The lights dimmed, and I could feel the excitement.
I was delighted to get the best seat in the theater.
About half way through the movie, I could understand why it was poorly attended.
Unfortunately i was a bit late because i couldn't find the room showing the movie.
As i was walking, i tripped over the stairs and spilled my snacks.

story: Ryan was a little boy and loved going to the picnic store. But his parents said that they couldn't afford anything from the store. Ryan decided to save his pocket money to go to the store. Ryan saved up enough pocket money to buy a picnic basket.
original_ending: Ryan's mum took him to his favourite place to get his basket.

endings.ending: Ryan went to the store and looked for a picnic basket, but found that they were all sold out, which made him feel very sad.
Ryan went to the store, but saw a new type of toy truck, which he then bought using the money he had saved up for a picnic basket.
He visited the picnic store this weekend but there was no picnic basket that he liked.
He bought a new picnic basket after saving up enough money and was delighted!
When he got to the store they were out of picnic baskets so he had to wait a few weeks.
However, when they went to the store it had been torn down and replaced with a Walmart.

story: Andre was invited to the park after school by the girl he likes. Andre was excited and was counting the hours till school was over. Finally school was over and her met her in the front. They went to the park.
original_ending: Well at the park they talked and looked at clouds.

endings.ending: Andre was so excited that he ended up making a fool of himself and they never went to the park again.
While they were there it started to rain heavily and they each had to go home early.
While walking over, Andre accidentally tripped over a curb and had to go to the hospital with a broken leg.
The two of them really hit it off and they agreed to marry each other that very day.
They talked about their day as they walked.
Andre made small talk as they made their way to the park.

story: Alex had a date with his girlfriend at 8:00. He forgot about his date and agreed to meet a friend at 8:30. Alex didn't want to let either of them down. He went on his date at 8:00 but then ended it early.
original_ending: His girlfriend was shocked to see them at a bar a few doors down.

endings.ending: His girlfriend was so angry she broke up with him and went back to her old boyfriend, an NFL quarterback.
Then he went to his friend, and realized he was in love with the friend instead of his girlfriend.
He decided to take his girlfriend to meet his friend 8:30
He decided he was tired, and went home without meeting his friend.
Alex's girlfriend slapped him for not spending enough time with her and left him.
Alex invited his girlfriend out with his friend, but she got bored and left.

story: Ethel was terrified of growing old alone. She kept a tight leash on her husband. Ethel couldn't allow him to go more than an hour without calling. Or texting, as he was doing when he missed the curve and crashed.
original_ending: Ethel lives alone, with nobody to blame for it but herself.

endings.ending: Ethel's husband got tired of her controlling nature and left her one day, leaving Ethel miserable.
Ethel eventually got help and saw a therapist and now she goes out every day with her husband.
She regrets not buying him the hands free adapter that he asked for.
She will never forgive him for leaving her.
Ethel now thinks that instead of forcing her husband to stay in touch with her at all times, she should have simply locked him up in the house.
Ethel feels a little guilty for what happened to her husband, but on the other hand, she has realized that she actually quite enjoys living alone.

story: Bella is a 3 year old girl. She woke up at 7AM this morning and was full of energy. Bella's mom took her to the park after breakfast. After the park, Bella went to the mall for Christmas Shopping.
original_ending: Bella got home before lunch and fell asleep from running around town.

endings.ending: She didn't like anything there and went to a different store.
She bought some gifts for her family and they loved it.
Bella's face lit up when she saw Santa Claus at the mall.
Bella was full of joy when she told her father about their day when he got home from work that evening.
Bella's dad came afterwards to take her back to his house, so she could spend time with her half-siblings.
Bella got home late at night after spending some time with her grandparents at the mall.

story: Tom ate a lot and got fatter and fatter. I asked him why he ate so much. He said it was because his wife, Mary, kept buying food. I asked Mary why she bought so much food.
original_ending: She said it was because Tom kept eating the food.

endings.ending: Mary said she was trying to see if Tom would explode from eating way too much.
Mary told me she was paranoid the stores would run out of food because of the pandemic crisis continuing.
Mary said the way to a man's heart is through his stomach.
Mary said that she doesn't, and that Tom was sneaking snacks constantly.
Mary said her mother always told her to keep her man full.
Mary seemed offended by the question and left.

story: Trudy felt sad so thought she needed a pet. She decided to buy a Puli. She called some Puli owners in town and asked to buy one. The third Puli owner agreed to sell Trudy one of her dogs.
original_ending: So Trudy bought a Puli and is now much happier.

endings.ending: The owner and Trudy then argued about price, forcing Trudy to walk away.
Trudy bough the Puli and regretted it as it was very mean right away.
Trudy didn’t realize that being a pet owner is exhausting as well as expensive and completely regretted her decision.
That night, a fire broke out in neighbors apartment and Trudy’s new dog woke her up saving her life.
The Puli owner turned out to be a scammer and tried to rob her when the owner met her, but she escaped unharmed without the pet.
Trudy met the third Puli owner and they fell madly in love and lived happily ever after.

story: We went to dinner last night. My wife opened the door. The next morning she could not find her keys or open the door. The keys were in the door and we could not get out.
original_ending: Her sister lives in the building and got us out.

endings.ending: My wife realized she had another set of keys in the kitchen drawer so she use them to get out.
We decided to go out the back door and retrieved the keys and open the door.
We ended up calling a locksmith to pick our lock and to let us out of the house.
We then searched and found the spare keys to the door, which we used to open the door.
We called the building supervisor and he got us out.
We climbed down the fire escape and went back up to the apartment and took the keys out.

story: Camping in the fall sounded like a good idea. Jen did not want to sleep on the cold ground. She brought an air mattress to sleep on. She was freezing all night and did not get any sleep.
original_ending: The air in the air mattress was colder than the ground.

endings.ending: She realized she left the heating mattress in the car, tonight she'll get a much better sleep.
She took a hot shower in the morning, which made her feel much better.
The air mattress did not end up staying inflated and she sunk to the ground.
Even though the air mattress was not as cold as the ground the air in the tent still made her shiver.
The air mattress failed to inflate and Jen ended up having to sleep on the ground.
The weather for that night was unseasonably cold and windy so the ambient air proved too chilly given Jen's thin layers.

story: The basketball game was tied 30-30. One of the players had been fouled and was up to shoot. He had a chance to shoot two free throws. If he made them, he would win the game for the team.
original_ending: He took his time and shot the ball and made both of them.

endings.ending: He missed both shots and was kicked off the team.
But running to get into position the player slipped and twisted his ankle.
He was very nervous, so he took a deep breath.
He could feel the pressure of his teammates on him.
He went to the bathroom and vomited because of the nerves.
He missed both throws and ran out of the gym in a rage.

story: Gina's friend Lisa offered to show her how to ride the bus. Gina's mom agreed, but told them not to go to the mall. They agreed not to go to the mall. However once on the bus they changed their mind.
original_ending: They walked around the mall for hours with no real money to spend.

endings.ending: Gina's mom found out and grounded her for a week.
The bus had stopped operating once they were done with their shopping trip so Gina had to call her mom to take her home.
As soon as they got there, though, Gina's mom called and found out that she had disobeyed her.
The bus broke down on the way there and their plans were ruined anyway.
They got off the bus and decided to go to the amusement park instead.
Once they got to the mall, they bought a train ticket and headed downtown instead.

story: It was Jilly's 5th birthday. Her mom baked her a fancy cake. When it was time to blow out the candles, she couldn't. It looked like they were going to go out but then they stayed lit.
original_ending: Her big brother had put trick candles on her cake.

endings.ending: Jilly's mother had to eventually blow out the candles with some cardboard paper.
Jilly's brother had to blow out the candles for her with all of his strength.
They were magical candles and would stay lit until she did a good deed.
She got angry, so she grabbed the punch bowl and poured the entire thing on the cake, which made it taste even better.
Jilly began to feel fustrated.
The mom took off the candles after a few minutes.

story: My friend needed help with his homework assignment. Since class started in 10 minutes, I allowed him to copy my work. The next day, I forgot to bring my lunch to school. When my friend noticed, he was disappointed to.
original_ending: On the bright side, he shared some of his lunch with me.

endings.ending: I ended up starving the whole day.
I went to McDonalds with some friends after school.
My friend ended up eating lunch all by himself, and I went back to class hungry.
He was not only disappointed that I forgot my lunch, but also that the answers he copied off from my homework were wrong, and that he got an F for the assignment.
Turns out my friend had also forgotten to do something, bring his school work he copied from me.
A nice teacher walked by and saw our down faces and bought up pizza to eat.

story: Vince woke up one morning and got up to put clothes on. When he looked for an outfit, he could not find anything to wear. Vince noticed he had a lot of dirty laundry and decided to wash it. After loading the clothes into the washer, he began to wait.
original_ending: After drying the clothes, Vince had a nice outfit to wear.

endings.ending: Whereupon he changes his mind and puts on dirty clothes.
He looks astonished to see the washing machine answering him back.
It took longer than he thought to finish the wash so he had to wear something dirty.
The clothes finished washing but he had forgotten to put detergent in beforehand.
At that moment, he regretted firing his housekeeper.
After waiting for an hour, he decided to wear a dirty outfit for the day and do the laundry later.

story: Jane's eyes were unusually large. As she walked through the park, she attracted much attention. A teenage boy stopped Jane on the path and asked her a question. Jane knew the boy was just wanting to talk to her.
original_ending: Jane answered the boy and went on her way with a smile.

endings.ending: Jane. approached the boy and ask him what he wanted.
Jane turned to the boy and ask him why he wanted to talk to her so much.
Jane was ready to fall in love but it wasn't the boy would would be her first love, it was the neighbor girl.
When there was no one looking Jane, gave the boy a peck on the cheek to test his reaction, he responded in kind.
The boy was just asking for directions.
They ended up married a few years later.

story: Gina was walking home from the park. A dog that was loose at the park had begun following her home. She stopped and let the dog catch up with her. The friendly dog licked her hand, and looked up at her.
original_ending: She decided she would ask her mom if she could keep the dog.

endings.ending: Mary took the dog to the animal shelter so it's own could be found.
Gina made posters and put them all around the neighborhood looking for the dog's owner.
Gina found a frisbee laying there and threw it as far as she could so the dog would run after it.
Gina took a cookie out of her pocket and gave it to the hungry dog.
Gina went back tot he park a few days later and saw missing dog signs for the same dog.
When Gina got home she gave the dog some deli meat.

story: Sarah's kid loved cereal and finished all of the cereal. So Sarah had to go get cereal from the store. So Sarah drove to the store in the morning. She found her daughter's favorite cereal and bought four boxes.
original_ending: Her daughter was happy to have more of her favorite cereal.

endings.ending: Sarah's kid decided she no longer liked that cereal after having a bowl.
When Sarah was checking out, the cashier told her about the promotion with the cereal and she was able to get 2 gallons of milk for free.
Unfortunately, when she got home, she realized she bought the wrong cereal.
Her daughter got tired of the cereal and wanted something different.
Unfortunately, the daughter was tired of that cereal and wanted another brand.
When she got home, she looked at the box and noticed that the cereal were expired.

story: Marsha went home for Christmas. She met her mom and her dad at the airport. Her parents told her they were happy to see her. She said the she was happy too as long as mom made macaroni salad.
original_ending: Marsha's mom said that she already did and it's waiting at home.

endings.ending: They all laughed at Marsha's macaroni salad request and gave her a big hug.
Marsha's mom said that was a warm weather dish and they would have it next July 4th if she came home to visit.
There was an awkward pause before Marsha's parents informed her that the house had been repossessed by the bank, and that they were now living in a small apartment.
On the way home, Marsha revealed to her parents that she was pregnant.
This time, there was no cheese in it and the new recipe was dairy free and vegan.
Marsha decided to sample the macaroni before it was ready and received a stern scolding from her mother.

story: Lenny was laying on his couch watching TV. His cat came inside and jumped into his lap. Lenny began scratching the cat when he noticed the bugs in it's fur. He put the cat in the bathroom.
original_ending: Then, he quickly went out and bought some bug cream.

endings.ending: He was happy that he had a rare cat that enjoys water and baths.
Then he got his mom to wash the cat because she is the only person the cat won't fight when cleaning it.
Lenny ran the bath and gave the cat a really good wash.
He left it there while he found the number for a local vet.
He washed and shampooed his cat thoroughly.
He called the vet and asked her what he should do.

story: Madison had gone to a park for the Fourth of July. They were all heading back to the car after the fireworks. Suddenly, Madison realized her camera was missing. She and her mom checked every inch of the park looking for it.
original_ending: Finally, they discovered that it had been in the car all along.

endings.ending: They never found it, so Madison's mother surprised her with a brand new camera for her birthday.
Later that week, it was recovered at a pawn shop after Madison's mother submitted a police report.
She caught herself and found it in her back pocket.
Her mom barely spotted it hanging from the tree where they were sitting earlier.
They gave up and used their camera phones instead.
Madison's mother quickly drove back home and retrieved the camera.

story: It was summer break and Lucy was at her grandparents. She wanted to speak with her friends from home. She called her friend Amy who told her there was party later. Lucy felt left out since she couldn't go.
original_ending: Amy offered to call from the party so Lucy would feel included.

endings.ending: Her grandparents were nice enough to drive her there when they saw how dejected she was.
Due to this, Lucy decided to plan her own party the very next weekend and all her friends came!
Lucy decided to throw a party when she got back so she could spend time with her friends.
She ended up spending time with her grandma and had fun anyway.
Lucy organized a party at her grandparent's house instead.
Lucy broke her friend with Amy for having a party without her.

story: I always wanted to swim with the dolphins. I saw dolphins when I was at Sea World with my family. I asked my mom if we could swim with them. She wouldn't let me because it cost too much money.
original_ending: I was disappointed that I couldn't swim with them that day.

endings.ending: Luckily, I had been saving for just such an occasion and I was able to pay for it myself!
I begged and pleaded and eventually my mom said it was okay.
I showed my mom that I could pay for it with my own money.
I watched enviously as others swam with the dolphins, wishing it were me instead.
I got a job eventually and was able to swim with the dolphins.
A kind old man came by and gave me the money to swim with them.

story: Mark decided to go out of town to find a job. While looking for a job she saw a lady looking for job too. He decided to talk to the lady and ask her name. Her name is beth and they decided to look for a job together.
original_ending: Since then they became friends and they both have a job.

endings.ending: Mark was able to quickly find a job, but Beth is still looking.
Beth was able to find a job, but Mark decided to start a business instead.
Beth and Mark were both hired for the same company and became good friends.
After looking for a job together, Mark asked Beth to go out to dinner with him to celebrate their accomplishments.
Mark found a job, but Beth didn't.
They didn't find a job, but they did fall in love and get married.

story: Will's friends wanted him to go camping with them. Will didn't want to go so he lied to them about a previous engagement. His friends went on their trip without him. One of his friends ran into his mom the next day and asked about it.
original_ending: Will was caught in his lie and his friends were upset.

endings.ending: His mom lied and said he had to go perform at the Grammy's instead of the trip.
His mom revealed she wasn't actually his mom but a zombie imposter so she didn't know why he didn't go camping.
Will's mom lied for him and saved him embarrassment.
She did not recognise her son's friend and ignored him completely.
His mom took Will's side and lied for him about the engagement.
His mom pretended she did not know about the engagement and will was never caught.

story: Janet went to a farm with her class. They were all having fun looking at the animals. Janet walked over to a lamb. She was given a snack to give the lamb and enjoyed feeding it.
original_ending: The rest of the day Janet stayed by the lambs side.

endings.ending: The lamb ended up licking Janet and laid down right beside her.
Janet then tried on of the snacks for herself to see what it taste like and she thought it was disgusting.
Once the lamb had the snack, it went back to it's momma.
She tried to give the lamb a second snack and it bit her hand.
The lamb got sick and Janet was blamed for the catastrophe.
She realised on a closer look that the lamb was in fact a lion's cub.

story: Oscar the cat woke up very hungry. First, he looked in his own bowl for some cat food. He found no food there. Then, he looked in the dog's bowl for some food.
original_ending: He was so hungry that he ate all of the dog's food.

endings.ending: Just as Oscar was about to start eating the dog's food, the barking dog appeared and chased him away.
Unfortunately, the dog's food disgusted Oscar, so he went to look for his master and kept meowing until he got fed.
He gagged and decided to go after a mouse to eat.
There was no food in the dog's bowl, so Oscar slept while waiting for his owners to come home.
He sniffed the dog food, but it stunk, so he walked away hungry.
He saw cat food in the dog bowl and went wild eating it.

story: In the morning, I would let the dog out and go back to bed. I would leave the door unlatched so that he could get back in. After a few minutes, he would come back in and hop on the bed. He would sit on the bed until I finally got up.
original_ending: This continued until the day he came back in with a dead chipmunk.

endings.ending: I could never sleep however as I was always anxious about his coming back.
Sometimes he would take a very long time and I had to get up and bring him in.
One morning he came in with dog poop all over his feet.
One day he came in covered in mud and shook himself off all over the bed.
This time the dog didn't come back in a few minutes and I had to go out and look for him.
This time the dog came back limping as it looks like he got in a fight with another animal.

story: At first the Wilcos thought getting a puppy was a good idea. It was cute and playful and small. Then it started growing and playing harder. Now they're too afraid of it to let it out of the basement.
original_ending: It won't let them call animal control and they don't know what to do.
