Her mom saw how much Gina loved the dog but told her she had to pay for the vet to keep the dog.

story: Fiona loved to go to the barn to ride her horse. As she drove up to the barn she saw horses on the road. She stopped her car and ran to get help from the other horse riders. Fiona along with the other owners herded the horses back into pasture.
original_ending: The horses were safe and Fiona could now go for a ride.

endings.ending: Instead of riding, she spent the day fixing the broken fence.
Unfortunately her horses were still missing so she had to get in her car and look for them.
The horses were so scared they needed a break to rest.
Fiona was thanked by the other riders and was asked if she wanted to ride.
Then Fiona asked her dad to fix the fence.
Then Fiona went home to get dinner.

story: There was a closet in Gina's grandma's room. When she was young the door was always open. But a chair in front of the door kept it closed for Years. She had forgotten the closet was there.
original_ending: Until the chair was moved, and the door was opened once again.

endings.ending: When she remembered the closet, Gina concluded that the door was blocked for some reason, so she decided to keep it that way.
Ginny never remembered the closet for the rest of her life, nor did she ever find out why the chair was blocking the door.
She had forgotten what was locked in the closet.
Once she died the family opened the closet and discovered all of grandma's secrets.
And then one morning, she heard scratching behind the door.
When her grandmother passed away, Gina opened the door and found it was stacked floor to ceiling with $20 bills.

story: Ted is the first of his friends to own a car. All of his friends want rides to school everyday. Ted only has room in his car for six people. Ted told his friends whoever is willing to pay for gas can get a ride.
original_ending: Ted has made a nice little side business while driving to school.

endings.ending: Ted's friends didn't like Ted's decision.
Ted noticed that the friends disappeared after that.
Ted then decided he wants to be a taxi driver.
Then Ted's car broke down the next day and he was out of luck.
None of them wants to spend the extra money and he rides everyday alone.
Only five of his friends are able to pay him, while his other friend has to go to school alone.

story: I had a terrible customer at the restaurant today. She asked for a bottle of wine. When I brought the bottle of wine, she complained about the long wait. Although it had not been long at all, I apologized.
original_ending: Instead, I wish I could have told her that she was rude.

endings.ending: I "accidentally" overcharged her to make up for it.
She left no tip.
I realized that not everyone is a nice person.
She rolled her eyes and then was rude to the other servers.
I decided to comp her the bottle of wine in hopes of a good tip.
Turns out she was a secret shopper and was rating how staff treat guests, so I was glad I was cordial.

story: The student snuck up the stairs and onto the second floor. He crept down the hall towards the locked door. Using a pin, he picked the lock of the door and snuck inside. He took money from the teacher's desk and was about to leave.
original_ending: The teacher walked in the room and caught him in the act.

endings.ending: He suddenly saw a scary ghost behind the desk and fainted.
But then to his shock he found the door to be locked from outside.
He thought about what he was doing and had a change of heart and put the money back.
He snuck back out the door he was going to buy the homeless family down the road food with the money.
It was then that he saw the security camera and knew he'd be found out.
He knew what he was doing was wrong, so he put the money back and ran out the door.

story: Paul heard a funny noise coming from one of his car tires. He took it to the shop to get it looked at. The mechanic checked it out. The mechanic told Paul he found the problem.
original_ending: The mechanic held up a piece of cardboard stuck next to the tire.

endings.ending: The mechanic told Paul the lug nuts were loose and tightened them for him.
The mechanic noticed that a piece of metal had bent from a recent fender bender the car was in and was scraping against the tire.
He told that the tire needs to be changed.
The car tire has gotten too loose and it was good that Paul had taken to the mechanic or else there would have been an accident.
there was a tool next to the tire.
there was a nail in the tire.

story: Eddie and Carol were on their way home, driving across the country. There was no reason for them to get home right away. They decided to take their time and stop at lakes to swim, everyday. It was a hot summer, and those hours spent swimming cooled them off.
original_ending: These lake breaks made the trip longer, but well worth it.

endings.ending: They ended up camping by one of the lakes and it made them enjoy their trip even more.
They were not looking forward to going back home.
They eventually decided this was the vacation.
They eventually packed their things and continued on their travels.
Unfortunately, one of the lakes was contaminated with amoebas and they both passed away some months later.
They were sad when they entered the desert and could no longer enjoy lake stops.

story: There once was a mean old woman who lived all alone. The reason she was so mean is because she was lonely. One day, a nice old man came to her door. When she met the old man, all of her anger left her heart.
original_ending: The old woman and the old man became friends and lived happily.

endings.ending: The man ended up stealing money from her just a few days later.
The man ended up proposing to her and they ended up getting married.
The man was her son who had travelled back in time to meet his mother.
She soon realized the man was her lost husband who had found her again.
And the old man fell in love with the old woman.
Then they began to meet everyday and loved each others company.

story: Angie wanted to surprise her kids with a trip to the zoo. She packed up the things they would need for the day. The kids got in the car and she told them she had a surprise. She pulled into the zoo parking lot.
original_ending: The kids were excited to see that they were at the zoo.

endings.ending: The kids all screamed with joy because they wanted to see the lions.
The zoo was at capacity so they had to cancel their trip.
However to their dismay, the zoo was closed for the day.
The kids were excited to go to the zoo but they were even more excited to see the ice cream truck in the parking lot.
To Angie's surprise, the kids were all asleep when they got to the zoo.
The kids were sad they weren't going to Disney.

story: Rachel was studying to become baptized. She was nearing the end of her lessons. Her teacher asked her if she was sure that she wanted to do it. Rachel thought about it.
original_ending: She had a change of heart and decided not to go through with it.

endings.ending: she said yes and was baptized.
she decided to wait a little longer and then got baptized.
Rachel knew that it was what she wanted all along so she did it.
She couldn't decide so she asked her family to give her advice.
In the end she assured herself once again about the passion she carries for becoming a baptist.
Although as first thought she was hesitant to go till the end, after comparing her alternatives she decided to finish the course with necessary perseverance.

story: Amy asked Jim to come over to watch the parade on TV. Jim and Amy had a great time watching all the cartoon character floats. The parade was ending and the kids were excited to see the last float. Just then Amy's dad came into the room and stumbled on the cord.
original_ending: They hurriedly plugged the TV back in, but the parade had ended.

endings.ending: He plugged the TV back in just in time to see the end of the parade.
The TV fell to the floor and shattered.
Amy's dad crashed into the TV and it was broken.
Amy and Jim found the parade on youtube and enjoyed watching the end.
Lucky it was a commercial and her dad apologized for what he did.
The TV stayed plugged in and they ended up watching the last of the parade with Amy's dad.

story: One night my family had a dinner party. There was lots of food, especially lots of pie! That night I ate way too much pie! Eating so much pie gave me such a belly ache!
original_ending: Next time I will make sure not to eat so much pie!

endings.ending: I didn't learn my lesson, and ate an entire key lime pie in the morning for breakfast.
I had sharp, stabbing, pains in my stomach, and had to go to the emergency room, where the doctor told me to limit my pie intake to one pie daily.
The next night, I ate a whole pie.
My family found this out and threw out all the pie.
I could barely get out of bed the next day.
I really enjoy stuffing my face.

story: The man went golfing with a friend. The man lost all of his balls in the trees. He asked his friend for some balls. His friend did not have any balls for him to borrow.
original_ending: The man watched his friend finish the round of golf.

endings.ending: He went to the club house and spent more money than he wanted to buying new ones.
Another golfer over heard them and gave him some of theirs so he could finish the round.
The man thought that $4 a ball was a lot to pay, but the squirrel selling the balls really had him in a tough spot.
The man's husband ended up picking him up at the course because he was too drunk to drive home.
He then checked one of the cup and found a ball there.
He got upset and returned home.

story: I was trying to tell my uncle a message. However, he kept interrupting me when I'm talking. I tried to speak over him but he wouldn't stop. I immediately walked away.
original_ending: He didn't say a single word to me for the rest of the day.

endings.ending: But all of a sudden, he appeared right in front of my path again so I told him how he made me feel.
Strangely, I never saw him again after that.
I get irritate when my uncle was talk nonstop.
After a day my uncle was calling to talk with me.
Maybe I should had said something before walking off because until this day my uncle doesn't talk to me anymore.
I was surprised when my uncle started to walk alongside with me without stop talking.

story: Ira went to the store to buy something to eat. Chips were on sale so he bought a bag. Ira counted the chips as he ate them. The last whole chip in the bag was number 63.
original_ending: Ira ate the small crumbs and counted them as chip number 64.

endings.ending: He decided to go hack to the store and get another pack of chips.
He felt that was his lucky number and was excited about it.
Ira was upset because the bag advertised 70 chips per bag.
Ira was excited because that was the most chips shes ever eaten in one sittings.
Era took a another bag of chips and began counting again.
Era was surprised with the number of chips in the bag.

story: Elizabeth had to leave her toddler alone for a minute. She went to the bathroom and then came back. She saw that her toddler had emptied out an entire pack of baby wipes. There were baby wipes all over the room.
original_ending: She had to collect them all and shove them back into the plastic.

endings.ending: She used the baby wipes to clean the dust in the room.
The baby started crying when she saw how disappointed Elizabeth was.
She picked up the toddler and put the down for a nap.
She yelled at the toddler for their behavior.
She giggled, vowed not to leave the toddler alone anymore and threw the baby wipes into the trash.
She yelled at the toddler for making a mess and told them to clean it up.

story: Robin's mom had already left for work. She decided she was too sick to go to school. There wasn't much in the house to eat. She made a bowl of cereal and went back to bed.
original_ending: She ate cereal while watching reruns of old TV shows.

endings.ending: she ate the cereal while listening to music.
she ate the cereal while playing video games.
She slept until her mother got home from work.
Her mother came home during the day and yelled at her for skipping school.
She couldn't sleep because her stomach was hurting.
She didn't go bed but instead watch a movie.

story: Little Johnny wanted a new Star Wars lunch box. He asked his mom to go to the store. He picked out a new one with chewbacca on it. He thought it was so awesome and couldn't wait to show his friends.
original_ending: He was so pumped to bring in his new lunch box to school tomorrow.

endings.ending: When he showed his friends they thought it was nerdy and made fun of him.
When he made his lunch in the morning the lunchbox broke before he got to use it.
However, when he showed it to them they laughed at it.
The next day he showed his friends and made them all jealous.
The next day he was so excited to go to school he forgot his new lunchbox
Johnny spent all night dreaming of his friends’ reaction to his new box.

story: My family went to the water park since today was a holiday. My brother and I were the first people in line for the lazy river. We spent a couple of minutes floating around the water. After we got out, we went towards the huge slide.
original_ending: Since the line in front of the slide was large, we waited for a while.

endings.ending: We climbed up the big ladder to the slide, but once we got to the top, I was too scared to go down it and climbed back down.
When we got to the slide, we were first in line, and we landed in the water with a big splash!
We went running and I slipped, hitting my head hard into the ground.
Up there I was afraid to go that my brother gave me a little push, and it was the best slide ever.
We were both scared, but we both acted nonchalant in a poor attempt at masking our feelings.
I was in awe at the size of slide and thoroughly enjoyed it when it was my turn to go down the slide.

story: We open our swimming pool every year in April. We always find a few sacs of frog's eggs floating around in the water. I use my pool net to fish them out and place them in a bucket. I put the bucket in my car and drive it to a nearby pond.
original_ending: When the eggs hatch the tadpoles will be in their new pond home.

endings.ending: This year it appeared that the pond had dried up, so I had to go find a new one.
This year I retrieved more eggs than ever.
There are lots of dragonflies at that pond that just love to eat frog's eggs!
The pond hasn't had frogs in a long time, and I'm still trying to find out why the eggs don't hatch.
Sadly, though, the eggs never hatched that year so I was at a loss.
Unfortunately, my car broken down on the way to the pond so I had to address the issue urgently.

story: Fred was on the farm milking the cows. He milked dozens of cows that morning. He packed the milk in cartons and sold them to the store. The store was relieved because they were out of milk.
original_ending: Fred went back home to his farm to sleep for another day.

endings.ending: However, after that, store employees realized that the milk was spoiled and could not be sold, so they had to return it to Fred.
Fred realized that the store might need more milk in the future, so he went back to his house and prepared the cows to produce more milk.
A man was relieved because he needed milk for his cranky grandmother!
Then the store was robbed, and they shot up the milk, causing it to leak all over the floor, meaning Fred had to work even harder to milk his cows late into the evening.
But unbeknownst to Fred the cows had earlier invaded an onion patch, eating as many as they could, and all the milk tasted strongly of onions.
Fred's milk was the best in the entire area so the customers were delighted and word quickly spread causing the store to be sold out again in very short order.

story: Gina's 5th hour class was English. It was the first day so the teacher just talked for most of the class. Gina sat and bored waiting for class to end. When the bell rang she went to the hall looking for her friends.
original_ending: She gave up when the bell rang signalling the last class of the day.

endings.ending: As soon as she saw them she started waving a hand and waiting for them to notice her.
While looking, she saw, out of the corner of her eye, a strange figure peeking out of the bathroom.
She found her friends and they decided to skip the rest of the day!
She found her friends and they waved at each other in the hallway.
Then, Gina remembered that she had no friends.
She found one, but she was chatting with a new guy that she though was cute and Gina slinked away.

story: A third base coach gave the wrong sign to a player on first. The player ran to steal second base and was almost thrown out. The coach felt in the moment so he told the player to steal again. Once again the player tried to steal a base but was thrown out.
original_ending: That was the third out and the inning was over.

endings.ending: The manager of the team reprimanded the coach after the game for the call.
The player was so upset with the coach that they demanded the team trade them.
The next player hit a homerun and they still won the game.
The third base coach was fired the next day.
These unfortunate plays ultimately cost the team the game.
The third base coach reflected on his poor signing, and endeavored to improve for the remainder of the season.

story: Pete checked a book out from the library. He brought it home and began to read. While reading he got up to get a drink and snack. When he came back, he accidentally spilled his drink on the book.
original_ending: Pete ruined the book and had to pay the library for it.

endings.ending: The stain highlighted the exact paragraph he had been searching for!
The library called and told him he needed to return it because someone else needed the book more.
He quickly grabbed napkins and cleaned it up and was able to save the book from being ruined.
after that he was more careful to not have drinks near his books when reading.
Pat noticed that only the top of the hardcover book had been wet so he was able to dry it off and save it.
Pat tried telling the library that it already had water damage.

story: Lisa is a nurse with a 4 month old baby girl. Her daughter's name is Megan. Lisa does not want to put Megan in daycare. Lisa asks her friends and family if they can babysit while she works.
original_ending: Lisa's mother says she is willing to watch Megan for her.

endings.ending: Lisa was unable to sleep, not knowing if she'd be able to find a babysitter.
Lisa asked her boss if she could take off a bit longer until she finds a babysitter.
Lisa becomes ill, and has to stay home from work which ends her search for a babysitter as she can do it herself now.
Lisa's friends and mother are all busy that day, so she relies on a childhood friend to look after her whom she hasn't talked to in years.
Eventually there were days when no one was available, so Lisa had to get used to the idea of ​​leaving her daughter in daycare.
As her daughter grew a little older, Lisa started taking her to work and her co-workers helped her look after her daughter, so she no longer needed the help of family and friends.

story: Javier has always asked his parents for a toy car. They know toy cars are expensive but they decide to get him one. On Christmas morning Javier's toy car is sitting under the tree. He takes it out for a first drive around the house.
original_ending: Unfortunately, the toy car isn't nearly as fun as he had imagined.

endings.ending: He immediately falls in love with the toy.
After just a short time, the toy's wheels break and fall off.
Javier had a ton of fun with the toy car and invited his friends over to play with it.
Javier crashed the toy car into a chair and cried.
Javier was thrilled and kept riding it forgetting about all of the other presents he hadn't yet opened.
Javier instantly fell in love with his new car so much that he decided to name it.

story: Last night we played truth or dare. It was my turn and I picked a dare. Rick dared me to jump in the lake. I was about to jump in the lake and I heard something.
original_ending: I looked in the water and their was a big alligator.

endings.ending: Rick had jumped into the lake before me, we had a great time swimming at night.
My parents came home and yelled at me for jumping into the lake at late at night.
It was my phone ringing, my mother wanted me to come home.
Someone was screaming for some help in the water!
I saw a big fish jump out of the water right in front of me.
I ignored what I heard and just jumped anyway.

story: I looked out my window and saw that my grass was getting tall. I decided that the grass needed to be mowed. I went outside and got the lawn mower from the shed. I worked for an hour cutting the grass.
original_ending: I sat on the porch and was proud of how good the grass looked.

endings.ending: After the hour, I realized that I had entered a fugue state, and had actually cut my neighbor's grass.
When I was finished, my wife came home and scolded me for cutting it, as she'd been cultivating a wild meadow there.
But the rain came down just as i was finishing.
My neighbor came out and complimented me on what a good job i did.
After an hour I was no where near finished and was so tired.
After seeing how good the lawn looked I decided to do the garden tomorrow.

story: My son did not know how to order food at a restaurant. I took my son to a restaurant with a children's menu. I then instructed my son to read the menu and select a food option. When the waiter came I told my son to tell the waiter his selection.
original_ending: My son now understands how to order food at a restaurant.

endings.ending: He was still confused so I ended up ordering for him this time.
He was very excited that he got to order on his own and ordered more than we could eat!
He preferred the adult dishes though, and wanted to quarrel about the portions.
He couldn’t decide between chicken nuggets and pizza, so I told the waiter to surprise him.
My son was too shy and refused to speak.
My son ordered three deserts and we all burst out laughing.

story: John carried a bag of birdseed to the backyard. He took the bird feeder off of its stand. He filled the bird feeder with birdseed. He placed the bird feeder back on its stand.
original_ending: John sat quietly to see if the birds would come to eat the seed.

endings.ending: But squirrels just ate all the birdseed instead.
But he bought the wrong kind of birdseed and the local birds wanted nothing to do with it.
He noticed no birds came to eat there that day.
Birds started showing up to eat soon after John put the feeder on the stand.
Even before he could take his hands off the feeder, the birds came flying to eat the seeds.
But the bird feeder broke and all the seeds scattered to the ground.

story: Bert liked to barbecue outdoors. He took a plate full of steaks and opened up his grill. Bert didn't know that wasps had built a nest inside of the grill. Some wasps flew out, stung Bert, and he dropped his plate of steaks.
original_ending: Bert decided to keep his grill in the garage when he wasn't using it.

endings.ending: Poor Bert had an allergic reaction and had to be rushed to the hospital.
Luckily nobody saw what happened, and Bert picked up the steaks and threw them on the grill anyways.
Bert felt defeat and went out to eat instead of enjoying steaks at home.
Bert picked up the steaks and washed them off before seasoning them all over again.
Bert went to get a match and started using smoke to get the wasps out.
Even though he was stung, Bert didn't feel much pain and continued to cook more steak.

story: Ali broke up with her boyfriend and was single again. She was lonely without a boyfriend to do fun things with. She joined a speed dating club and met a lot of new people. One of the new people she met was a nice man called Jamie.
original_ending: She went out on a fun date with Jamie, and they started dating.

endings.ending: She started dating Jamie but found that he was actually married, Ali felt so furious.
She started seeing Jamie but found out he was a sociopath and she was too afraid to break up with him.
Jamie turned out to be a grabby Sam and Ali was left at square one.
Jamie turned out to be a post-op trans man and Ali was VERY into it.
Later that man turned out to be a serial killer and was caught by the police.
After a few dates, she broke up with Jamie and became single again.

story: Sally's cat, Sam, loved playing with string. One day Sam got all caught up in some string while he was playing. He ended up getting so tied up that he could not get free. Sally had to cut the string to get him untangled.
original_ending: Afterwards Sam did not want to play with string anymore.

endings.ending: They went out to buy a new string to play with himthey went out to buy a new string to play with him
The cat really wanted the new string so they got him one
Regrettably, Sam had hurt his leg while caught and had to be brought to the vet.
Sally rushed right to the pet store afterward to buy Sam a bunch of new toys to play with.
She ended up being an hour late for work and got in trouble for it.
While she was handling Sam she realized that Sam was pregnant and they'd have a bushel of kittens soon!

story: Jim saves up his money all winter. When summer comes he has $20,000 for a paint job on his show car He gets the paint job on his classic car. Jim enters his car in a local auto show that summer.
original_ending: When Jim wins first place he recovers the money he spent on paint.

endings.ending: On the way to the car show, someone scratched up the side of the car.
Sadly, the car show gets cancelled and Jim is unable to show off his car.
Jim could not enter the show cause he didn't have a ticket.
Jim was kicked out of the show because he broke a car window at the show.
Jim has the car stolen at the auto show!
Jim crashes his car into another car inside the auto show and now has a big loss.

story: My sister and I used to always play outside together. One day we were playing and we saw this huge worm. We decided to find a stick and slice him in half. When we did this, each half of the worm went in a different direction!
original_ending: We were immensely grossed out and ran away screaming and laughing.

endings.ending: We buried both halfs.
We were surprised and kept slicing the parts.
The worms grew and grew and became as big as we were!
My sister and I each took a half of the worm and put them under our brother's pillow.
We then picked up both pieces and flushed it down the toilet.
Before we got to it the dog came by and ate the worm

story: Kyle had decided to teach his cat how to walk on a leash. That way he could take it for walks around the city. He went to the pet store and bought a leash and collar. The cat did not fight him at all when he put the collar on.
original_ending: They go for walks twice a day with no problems.

endings.ending: He thought he was good to go but the next day when they went for walks, his cat started acting up and was visibly frustrated with her new collar.
It turned out the collar was too loose and Kyle had to exchange it for a better fitting one.
The cat loves going out for their daily walks.
Kyle decided that maybe he can teach his cats some tricks like sitting down on command.
The cat began to enjoy walking with the leash and started to think it was a dog when it saw other dogs on leashes.
After a few days the cat had enough of the collar and attacked Kyle, so they never went on a walk again.

story: Joe woke up to see that his car was snowed in. Joe put on his warm cloths to go outside. Joe went outside and got his snow shovel. Joe worked for a long time shoveling the snow.
original_ending: Joe was proud when he saw he had cleared his car out.

endings.ending: With all that snow out, Joe decided to make a snow man in front of his house and out he went with his car.
After hours and hours shoveling the snow, Joe thought that warm water could do a better job.
Just when he thought he was done with it, a big pile of snow from the roof fell on the car.
But it was a busted flush as it wasn't his car.
But under the snow was a layer of ice, so Joe gave up.
Then he decided to pay a neighbor kid to finish the job.

story: Paula did not like the dark cabinets in her kitchen. One day she spilled pancake batter on the cabinets. The white mess looked almost like paint. Paula cleaned up the mess and got an idea.
original_ending: She painted her cabinets a lighter color and liked them more.

endings.ending: She decided she would only buy frozen pancakes from now on since they are less messy.
She hired a painter who painted her cabinets a different color
She painted the cabinets with pancake batter.
She went to the store and bought new cabinets the color of pancake batter.
She painted the cabinets exactly like the mess.
She will buy another cabinet.

story: Jen's family was very loud. When she went to see them that summer they were singing all the time. She took some time off in the woods to have some privacy. But they found her and made her come back to the house.
original_ending: Eventually Jen gave up and sang as loud as she could.

endings.ending: Jen became upset and started crying.
Jen started drinking and got drunk.
She sat in the corner with her back to them reading a book.
She went up on the roof and slept there through the night.
Jen's family promised that they would keep it down the rest of the trip.
Once she got back, her family was still singing so Jen just spent time in her room watching television.

story: Jim was at the park playing with his friends. He decided to show off and run down one of the slides. As he was going down the slide, he slipped and fell. He landed on his leg in a weird spot and broke it.
original_ending: Jim decided that showing off was not worth it anymore.

endings.ending: He was taken away in a helicopter which all of his friends thought was cool.
He was in a cast for several weeks and wasn't able to see his friends at school.
Jim cried in pain as his parents picked him up and hurried him to the car before going to the hospital.
Jim's friends ran away in fear while Jim laid in the sand in pain.
His uncle was a doctor, however, so he didn't wind up having to pay for the visit.
Jim was so stubborn that he never had it looked at and his leg would never be the same.

story: Working at Whataburger is a great job for students like Tom. Tom loves that they serve great food and offer flexible schedules. He told all of his friends how great his job is. Now all of his friends want a job at Whataburger with him.
original_ending: He is excited to work with some of his friends because it will be fun!

endings.ending: Unfortunately Whataburger is not in need of more employees, so Tom's friends are out of work.
Tom loved the place and he worked really hard, eventually he got promoted and managed to hire all his friends.
His friends later found out that Tom had been lying about his good time at his job.
After some days, the friends decide to start a burger joint themselves.
Tom was fired the next day for not following the rules.
Tom dropped out of school to work full time at Whataburger.

story: Michelle was playing with her friends near a rock wall. They were pretending to be animals and crawling along the rocks. Suddenly, Michelle slipped and fell. The distance to the ground was something like ten feet.
original_ending: Luckily, Michelle landed on some bushes and softened her fall.

endings.ending: She broke both legs and had to stay in bed for the rest of the summer.
She broke her neck in the fall and died instantly.
Unfortunately, it was too high for Michelle and she hurt her ankle.
Fortunately Michelle's friend was below her and was able to catch her before the fall.
Michelle suffered a fracture and broke her leg.
luckily she managed to cling on to a rope and everything was fine.

story: I have a new favorite show on television. The show is on every weekend and I never miss it. This week I have to be out of town for my job. I asked Jerry if he could record the show for me.
original_ending: He said he will and I can't wait to get back from my work function.

endings.ending: He said that he would record it and we'd watch when I got home.
He forgot, so now I have to find someone who recorded it and watch with them.
He said that he can't.
He said that he can but I believe that he is lying.
He told me I watch too much television and wouldn't record it.
He told me I could just watch it online.

story: My dad was in the navy when he was younger. But ever since then he hasn't been great on boats. Any time he is out on the water he feels sick. There was one time when we went deep sea fishing.
original_ending: The poor man was leaning over the boat the whole time being sick.

endings.ending: My dad told me a story about his time in the navy and what he had seen.
Once a fish was hooked my dad had a good time and forgot to feel sick.
I gave him some medicine to take before we got on the boat and it helped him a lot.
He turned green and then fainted on the deck.
My dad was sick that we had to end the fishing midway and he felt sorry about it.
We had a huge harvest that day and my dad was so concentrated that he didn't feel sick that day.

story: Lori bought a new bag last week. She had been saving up for a while to get it. She took it out to brunch with friends. When they got there two other women had the same bag.
original_ending: Lori pretended it was funny but was torn up inside.

endings.ending: As it turns out, the other women had bought very convincing knock-offs.
Lori was so embarrassed, she promptly went home.
Lori was so embarrassed that she ran away and nobody ever heard from her again.
It wasn't a big deal but the other women seemed very offended that she had the same bag, they accused her of stalking and copying them.
The had always been known as twins and this really confirmed it!
They laughed and decided to get matching shirts for the next time they went to lunch together.

story: Stewart's dad built a treehouse for him in the back yard. Stewart and his friends had great fun with the tree house. Stewart grew older and eventually had a son of his own. There were no large trees in Stewart's back yard.
original_ending: Instead of a tree house, Stewart built a fort for his son.

endings.ending: So Stewart planted a tree and told his son that one day he could build a tree house for his own kid there.
Stewart had to take his son to the park to play instead.
Stewart decided to move with his family to his old house, where his kid could have fun with his old treehouse!
Stewart planted a tree with his son so they could build a treehouse in the future.
He sold the house and moved to a new place which had large trees.
He got an artificial tree installed and build a tree house on top of it.

story: Two days ago I dropped my laundry of at the laundromat to be cleaned. When I got there the person working was on break. I had to wait around for like twenty minutes. She finally showed up and unlocked the doors.
original_ending: I paid her and got my laundry like I wanted.

endings.ending: I complained to her about the bad service and she apologized to me.
As soon as she opened, a big group of people entered the laundromat wanting to take their laundry
I lodged a lengthy complaint with the owner of the laundromat about the absence of employees.
I rushed in to get my laundry and injured my left arm when I accidentally ran into a corner of a laundry machine.
I was so angry and decided to cancel my subscription with them.
She apologized for the delay and offered me a discount for the inconvenience.

story: It was a chilly fall afternoon. Tabatha was raking the leaves in her front yard. She found a pregnant cat laying in a pile of leaves. She took the cat to her home to take care of it.
original_ending: The cat gave birth to 3 healthy kittens at her house.

endings.ending: The cat had two kittens and Tabatha decided to keep the them as she never had a pet in her life.
The cat had four kittens and Tabatha took the them to an animal shelter for adoption
Unfortunately, it was already ill and died after three days.
Tabatha soon had five new pets to take care of!
After a while Tabatha realized that she had an allergy to animal fur, and had to find the cat a new home.
Unfortunately, the cat didn't adapt to Tabatha's home, so she had to ask her sister to take care of the cat.

story: Growing up as a kid we lived near a pond. Their was a ton of frogs that lived in this pond. One day me and my little brothers caught as many frogs as we could. We brought them home and put them in our little plastic swimming pool.
original_ending: When my Dad got home he was amazed but made us take them back.

endings.ending: Little did we know, our pool had a hole in it and now our yard is covered in frogs!
My mother screamed in horror when she saw them and told us to get rid of them immediately!
Half of them jumped out of the pool and left.
We used our pool for a frog home instead of for swimming after that.
Our mom freaked out when she saw them and called pest control.
We kept them as pets for a while before they all ran away.

story: I was at the bar last night. I just stopped in for a few drinks with a girl. She was cute and I wanted to get to know her better. I went to go sit at the bar and the stool broke.
original_ending: I fell on my butt and she laughed at me.

endings.ending: She helped me up and we got to talking.
She thought I was pathetic and walked away from me.
She quickly caught me before I fell, so I bought her a drink.
I was laying on the floor feeling embarrassed, the girl ended up leaving.
I was so embarrassed but she helped me out to get up.
I was heart broken that I couldn't make a good appearance in front of her.

story: Charles was running behind schedule. He needed to grab his keys and leave for work. But he couldn't find his car keys. He looked all over his room, he even cleaned his room.
original_ending: He was ready to give up, picked up a book and found his keys.

endings.ending: He decided to give up on finding them and rode his bike instead.
Since he was unable to find them he decided to stay home and reschedule some of his events for a different day.
Charles was shocked to see his dog eating his keys!
For his surprised, Charles keys was inside his car all along.
He ended up having to take a taxi, and was late for work.
He got a call from his work that he is called off for today, so he went back to bed.

story: Francisco hadn't seen his mother in Years. He saved up money diligently for the flight to her home in Iowa. Finally the day had come for Francisco to fly to Iowa. He and his mother were very happy to see each other.
original_ending: Francisco promised he would never wait so long to see her again.

endings.ending: After a short visit, Francisco's mom had a stroke and died, and he was so glad to have seen her one last time before  she died.
Unfortunately, after visiting for an hour, they began to argue and Francisco remembered why he hadn't visited for so long.
To his surprise, he realized his mother had remarried.
To his surprise, his mother had cooked his favorite childhood meal.
The excitement escalated when Francisco revealed that he was getting married.
The reunion turned unpleasant when Francisco's mother introduced her new abusive boyfriend to her son.

story: Molly had a boyfriend that never paid any attention to her. She felt like she didn't matter and like she was invisible to him. He made her cry all the time and she knew she had to leave him. It wasn't easy to make up her mind to move on from him.
original_ending: She left one day and never went back and he still didn't care.

endings.ending: He begged for a second chance when she tried to break up with him and now he treats her a lot better.
Although brokenhearted, it was for the best because she met the love of her life a year later.
The boyfriend got incredibly upset that Molly left him.
Molly moved on for a day but went back to him after feeling intense regret.
So she decided to give him a final chance before moving on.
One day a policeman called and informed her about the death of her boyfriend in a car accident.

story: Meghan and Mikey were climbing trees. A branch broke and Meghan fell out of the tree! Mikey helped her get home to her parents. Her parents rushed her to the doctor and found out her leg was broken.
original_ending: Meghan got a cast on her leg and felt better!

endings.ending: For this moment on Meghan knew she was about to get a robotic leg she always wanted.
But sadly, Meghan fell off the hospital bed and broke her left arm.
Meghan vowed to never climb a tree again!
Meghan and Mikey decided to play indoor games from now on.
The doctor wasn't in, so they had to return home.
Meghan said her leg wasn't broken and she could walk fine.

story: Last friday was my sister's birthday. She really wanted a cake so I baked her one. I asked my friend to take it to my sister's house with me. On the way there, my friend dropped the cake on the car floor.
original_ending: We stopped at the store to buy a new one and my sister was happy.

endings.ending: We told her what happened, had a good laugh and we all ate smashed cake.
I was so mad that we had a huge fight, and the birthday was ruined.
He apologized profusely and offered to bake a new one.
Luckily it remained perfectly intact, and my sister loved it.
Once we arrived i explained to her what happened, and she understood.
We ended up taking my sister to the store and let her pick out a cake herself she wanted.

story: Being a stay at home dad is fun I get to take care of my kids. I get to see them grow up first-hand. I even get to make my wife happy when she gets home.
original_ending: I can't wait for her to see what I cooked tonight.

endings.ending: Despite this, I get tired more than if I spent the day working.
At the end of the night my wife rewards me.
It is far more fulfilling than I could have imagined.
I even got my kids to become fans of my favorite football team.
Tonight I plan to surprise her with a massage and bubble bath.
When she gets home I will tell her how I built the kids a tree house.

story: Amy loved tomatoes. She loved them so much that she decided to grow tomatoes herself. She bought a tomato plant and put it out on her front porch. The sun beat down on the tomato plant every day.
original_ending: After only a few days, the tomato plant died because of the sun.

endings.ending: After a few weeks, Amy saw that her tomatoes were starting to ripen.
Amy was able to share her delicious new tomatoes with her neighbors.
The tomato plant grew so large it took up the entire porch.
Amy picked tomatoes daily from her plant and enjoyed them!
The tomato plant got lots of sun and grew very tall and produced many tomatoes.
The tomato plant was eaten by a bunch of slugs and Amy was devastated.

story: Dan loved the New York Giants even though he lived in MN. He went to see them play when they came to play the Vikings. Dan's whole family was rooting for the Vikings. Dan was the only one in his group rooting for the Giants.
original_ending: Dan was proud of his team when the Giants won the game.

endings.ending: Dan was really upset when the Vikings won and his family made fun of him.
The Giants won by a huge lead and Dan smiled the whole way home.
His family ragged on him mercilessly when the Giants lost.
He put $50 on the Giants winning and won a whole bunch of money!
Dan was so sad when the Giants failed to score a point.
The game went into overtime and poor Dan fell asleep so he missed the ending!

story: A man was learning to play the trumpet. He was only able to figure out how to play two notes. He used the two notes to create a song. The song was not great but he was proud of it.
original_ending: He played the song for his friends and they clapped for him.

endings.ending: after a while he decided to stop playing.
when he played for his friends they said he wasn't doing well.
He kept practicing the trumpet every day and he was eventually able to play beautiful music.
His neighbors came and yelled at him because they were sick of hearing the same two notes over and over through the walls.
His friends thought it was terrible and laughed at him.
He kept practicing and went on to start his own ska band.

story: Jane and her friends were listening to music videos. They all wanted to pick the next song. Jane claimed it was her house so she gets to decide. The friends were upset but agreed.
original_ending: Jane picked a song and then let someone else pick the next one.

endings.ending: Jane saw that her friends were upset so she told them they could pick first.
Jane disregarded her friends and kept picking songs to the point where all her friends left.
Jane had picked out her friends favorite songs to play and was hurt they were upset.
Jane gave in and let her friends play whatever they wanted.
They hated listening to classical music.
Then, they decided to leave after listening to two songs.

story: The rich man decided to go on a trip around the world. He spun a globe and stopped it with his finger. The rich man bought a plain ticket to that country. The ticket was so cheap that he bought all the tickets on that flight.
original_ending: He handed out tickets to all his friends so they could join him.

endings.ending: He enjoyed his quiet flight with the best service ever!
All alone on the flight, he questioned the need for a mask.
He ended up giving the tickets away at a charity function later that evening.
He took the flight by himself and found himself in the tabloids being criticized for his carbon footprint.
He sat on the flight alone and abused the poor stewards and stewardesses.
He landed in Angola and was immediately kidnapped and held for ransom.

story: Gina needed to find something to fit in the door handle slot. The handle fell out and stranded her in the room. Nothing in the room fit in the handle slot. Finally she decided to try a Barbie doll leg.
original_ending: It was a long shot, but she had to try everything.

endings.ending: If this didn't work she knew that when her captor returned she'd never make it out alive.
She shouted with exultation when it worked and ran down the hall knowing she was late for her meeting.
To her surprise, the leg worked and she ran to the bathroom.
The leg did not work and she had to call someone to help from the outside.
The Barbie leg fit perfectly, and looked hilarious.
The leg got stuck in the hole, and she had to pull it out with pliers.

story: Boris went to the drive-in with his friends on Wednesday. He saw an old sci-fi movie. About half-way through, he bought some popcorn. He thought the cashier was cute, so he asked for his number.
original_ending: Boris is going to the drive-in again, tonight, with his new date.

endings.ending: When he tried texting the number later, he found that he had been duped, as the number was out of service.
He texted the number the next day and they made plans for coffee.
They hit it off and eventually got married.
He decided to call the next day only to realize it was a fake number
But the cashier refused to give his number and Boris was sad about it.
Boris got a number and they began talking daily.

story: Before my friend James died he wrote a letter. He told me he was sending it the next day. I believe he died before he sent it. I searched his apartment up and down to find it.
original_ending: When I did I found out it was addressed to me saying he loved me.

endings.ending: The letter contained a secret and James was worried that he would be killed for knowing it.
I never found the letter in the apartment, it was in my mail three days later.
It finally arrived at my apartment many weeks later and will be something I always treasure.
When I found and read it, I had to cry over the loss of such a good friend.
But I don't.
But the letters as unfinished.

story: My son went outside to play. A few hours after he came back in, my neighbor came over. He said he wanted to tell me how helpful my son was. He told me how he helped him rake leaves on his lawn.
original_ending: I went and found my kid and told him how proud I was.

endings.ending: I called my son and rewarded him with an ice cream cone.
I walked over to my son and gave him a pat on the head.
I asked the neighbor how much he planned to pay my son for his labor.
I asked my son where he found the rake and he said that he stole it from another neighbor's garage.
I was very happy to get to hear the appreciation of my son.
I encouraged my son to keep up the good work.

story: Daniel's pet mouse passed away in the night. The mouse, Albert, had been in the family for years. Daniel decided to bury him out back. He was sad as he placed his pet in the dirt.
original_ending: Daniel then went to the store to pick up some flowers for Albert.

endings.ending: He heard a squeak, and another mouse that looked exactly like Albert came out of a hole.
As Daniel laid him in the dirt, Albert vanished in a cloud of white smoke that blew away with the wind.
Daniel covered the mouse with the dirt and went back inside.
Daniel never told anyone what happened and everything thought Albert ran away.
Daniel then thought about the afterlife for the mouse.
Daniel decided to make the place where he buried Albert a pet cemetery.

story: Lilly had a nightmare that her Dad came home with a hole in his chest. She couldn't go back to sleep because it scared her so bad. The next morning she told her mom about the dream but mom laughed. She was embarrassed to tell her dad about how scared she was.
original_ending: Finally she told him and he just hugged her and told her he loved her.

endings.ending: She never told anyone and her dad was shot later that day and died.
She told her friend at school and they told her dreams don't mean anything so she felt better.
She told him two days later when the fear had decreased, and they laughed about it together.
She decided not to tell him, and reminded herself it had just been a dream.
She eventually never told her dad and kept it to herself.
She later told her older brother about who eventually told dad.

story: Joey was not tall enough to ride the big roller coaster last year. He knew he grew over the winter, but was it enough? He stood up as tall as he could at the height stick. He made it at last.
original_ending: He could finally ride the big roller coaster with his brother!

endings.ending: He realized that day he was an adrenaline junkie.
So then he realized that he could ride other fast rides that day too.
Now he could ride by himself.
Now that he was tall enough he was to scared to get on the big roller coaster.
The rollercoaster ride made Joey feel sick and he decided it wasn't worth the wait.
Joey loved the ride more than he even thought he would and got back in line four more times that day.

story: My mom told me a story about a scary house in a corner. I told my friends the story. We went to look for the house. We went inside the house and got scared by the clown that lives there.
original_ending: We went back to my house and promised to never speak of it again.

endings.ending: It all worked out though because now I live with my new dad, the clown, in the sewers.
It turned out the clown was just an old Halloween decoration.
When we got back home, we just had to tell everyone about it!
My friend passed out from all of the fear, and he fainted!
The clown jumped out at us as soon as we walked in.
The clown told us not to be scared and he was a friendly clown.

story: Bo loves to go for rides in the car. Bo will do anything to get to go for a ride. Bo escaped from the house one day. He would not come back to the house.
original_ending: We opened the car door, and Bo ran back fast and jumped in the car.

endings.ending: Despite how long and hard we tried, he would live outside for the remainder of his days.
That is, until we used his favorite treat to lure him back in.
After few months bo was found in the hill station riding a car.
Bo was very happy as he succeeded in escaping from the house.
I started looking for him with my car and when Bo came running to me after hearing the car honk.
A couple days later I foud Bo sleeping over the car.

story: The teacher warned the class that they have three minutes left. Henry was figuring out several questions that he left blank. He banged the desk since he was confused. At the final minute, he guessed on all of them.
original_ending: The teacher asked Henry to talk to him after class.

endings.ending: He ended up getting lucky and only getting one of the questions wrong.
Henry felt foolish and that he should have studied more.
The head banging worked since he got all the last questions correct!
Henry threw down his pencil and breathed a sigh of relief.
The teacher suspected that Henry had ADHD and made an appointment for him with the school counselor.
Henry couldn't believe it when he found out he got on A+ on the test.

story: When Jeff spoke to his friends, he pretended to know everything. He said that he knew how to build a canoe with his bare hands. His friends told him if he could do it they would pay him $1000. Jeff was shocked at such a challenge.
original_ending: The friends took this as a sign that he was lying.

endings.ending: He did his best to get out of it, but he knew his friends had called his bluff.
Luckily, Jeff's father was a master builder and Jeff knew exactly how to build a canoe.
He failed to make the canoe, and all of his friends shamed him.
He surprisingly built the canoe, and earned $1000
Jeff built the canoe and shocked his friends.
Jeff admitted to his friends that he was simply telling tall tales.

story: Amy and her friends were walking to the store. It was a cold October day. Amy had slept at Lynn's and only brought a jacket. Now she wished she had a coat.
original_ending: Amy made them walk faster to get to the store and out of the cold.

endings.ending: Luckily there was a second hand clothing store on the way and they stopped in to buy Amy a warm coat.
Amy called her mom and she picked them up to drive them to the store.
Luckily, Amy's friend had an extra coat and let her borrow it.
Amy and her friends got to the store quickly but it ended up being closed.
Amy blew on her hands to warm them up.
They decided to get hot chocolate before going to the store.

story: For track practice, we had to do a box jump at 48 inches. I had never done it before and I knew I was scared. Other people went and completed the jump. When I stepped up, I was very nervous.
original_ending: However, in the end I was able to complete the jump.

endings.ending: I ended up messing the jump up and fell flat on my face.
I completed the jump better than anyone else and everyone cheered for me.
The gash on my shin needed eight stitches.
The basketball coach saw me jumping and asked me to join the basketball team for the next season.
I eventually passed out from fear.
I decided to do my best and leap.

story: We were driving to the mall one day. I was listening to my favorite song on the radio. I was singing as loud as I possibly could. Just as I hit the highest note the song unexpectedly stopped.
original_ending: My wife had received a text and her bluetooth shut off my music.

endings.ending: My singing made my wife uncomfortable so she tuned off the radio.
I slammed the car into a tree and the car shut off.
It was then that I realized how badly I was singing.
My friend couldn't stop laughing at the situation.
I looked we were at the mall parking lot and a group of kids were staring at me.
I looked over and saw my wife shut the radio off and had that look on her face.

story: Often deer came into the Jones' yard in the fall. One evening near dusk, Mister Jones let the dog out for a few minutes. When he opened the door to get the dog back in, he was surprised. A few yards from the house, the dog was playing with another animal.
original_ending: It was a small deer that seemed to think it was a dog, too.

endings.ending: Taking a closer look, he noticed he wasn't playing but attacking it.
He got closer and realized it was not hsi dog but two baby deers
A large deer was chasing the dog around in circles in a playful way which made Mister Jones laugh.
A whole family of deer had come into the yard and began wrestling around with the dog.
The dog was riding around on the back of a deer!
There was a deer playing tug of war with the dog over a piece of rope!

story: In the morning I got out of bed a little late. To make up for lost time I did not make a lunch. By the time I left the house I was only 2 minutes late. The traffic was light so I made it to work on time.
original_ending: My boss had no idea I was running late that morning.

endings.ending: My boss still chastised me for not clocking in five minutes early.
Once inside the building, I decided that I no longer wanted to be exploited and dumped trash on the floor to get fired.
My boss noticed that I was a little late.
The next day I set two alarm clocks in a row so as not to miss the time again.
I had to miss lunch that day and I was moody all afternoon.
My colleague saw I had no lunch and let me share hers!

story: Ronda had always wanted to see a rhinoceros. She saved up her money for a big trip to the city zoo. At the zoo she saw a huge rhinoceros. It was much bigger than she had ever imagined it would be.
original_ending: Ronda was so happy she got to see a rhinoceros.

endings.ending: Ronda tried to give food to rhinoceros.
Ronda told features about rhinoceros to her friends.
Ronda asked if she could ride the rhino.
The rhino made a loud sound and scared Ronda.
The rhinoceros gallivanted around the enclosure and entertained the onlookers.
Ronda took several pictures of the rhino and decided to show them to her friends when she got the chance.

story: Oliver had a spelling test in class. The test began and he tried to do his best. At the end, his teacher collected all of the papers. She took them to her desk to grade them.
original_ending: When she was done, Oliver saw that he had passed.

endings.ending: A few minutes later, she called him up to her desk to reprimand him for his poor performace.
After she had graded all of the tests, she put Oliver's up on the board to show off his perfect score!
Once his test was returned Oliver saw that he had failed.
Oliver was so impatient that he got sent to the principal's office for talking while he waited.
He then gave the teacher an apple hoping it would improve his chances for a good grade.
She handed the papers back and he read the words he missed so he could learn them for the next test.

story: One day there was a man named Jim walking to the store. On his way his wallet slipped and fell out his pocket. The man behind him picked it up. He kept it instead of telling Jim.
original_ending: The man then went and bought loads of stuff with Jim's money.

endings.ending: Later that day, that man was arrested by the police for theft.
Jim followed the signal emitted by the transmitter he kept in his wallet and found the man with his wallet.
The man got arrested later when he tried to use Jim's credit card.
The man felt guilty and later left the wallet in Jim's mailbox.
I ran and warned Jim.
I started screaming: thief, thief!

story: Beth got out of bed, and noticed how nice it was outside. Beth thought it would be a good idea to go to the beach. She packed her favorite beach towel, water, and snacks. Once Beth arrived at the beach, she realized she forgot her sunscreen!
original_ending: Luckily, her friend Jill was there, and let Beth use hers.

endings.ending: She swam anyways, and got a horrible sunburn that itched all day.
Clouds came in, so she didn't use any sunscreen, and didn't burn.
She decided since she was already there she would still get some sun, but then regretted it later because it caused her to get a painful sunburn the next morning.
She didn't want to risk it so she decided to buy a large sun hat from a nearby hat stand near the beach.
Beth went to a nearby store and bought a new sunscreen.
She decided to go back home, because she did not want to get burned.

story: Marissa was a finalist in her school's spelling bee. She was not sure how to spell her next word. To fool the judges, she mumbled one of the vowels. Her trick worked and she won the spelling bee.
original_ending: Even though she won, she is not proud of her victory.

endings.ending: She's very happy!
She thinks that as a good plan.
Another competitor knew her trick and confronted her afterwards which embarrassed Marrissa a lot.
Marrissa felt guilty night after night and confessed to her teacher in the end.
She fought guilty and told the judges.
She was excited and bragged to everyone she was the best speller.

story: Rena thought she needed to buy a new car. She went out car shopping and looked at all kinds of models. She really liked one of the sports cars she test drove. When she got out she looked at the price.
original_ending: Rena decided she didn't need a new car after all.

endings.ending: She had more than enough money to buy the car and took it home that day.
Rena decided she like the car so much that she borrowed the money to buy the car right there and then.
It was little over her budget but anyway she bought it.
She didn't buy it as the price was over her limit but her lovely boyfriend later gifted her that car.
She took out a loan and bought the car.
She had to save up for a couple of years, and then came back and bought the car.

story: Elizabeth couldn't wait for her son Sam to take his first steps. She was determined to capture the moment on camera. She wanted to make sure she remembered it perfectly forever. But when Sam finally took his first steps, the camera wasn't charged.
original_ending: Elizabeth didn't mind that much - she knew she'd remember anyway.

endings.ending: Elizabeth started crying and the moment was forever ruined for her.
Elizabeth quickly grabbed her cell phone and used it to make the recording.
Elizabeth went and got another battery for the camera.
Elizabeth cried that she couldn't keep the moment forever.
She charged the camera and recorded Sam take other steps.
She felt sad over the camera but happy for Sam and hugged him.

story: Grandma needed her room painted. She called her son Adam to come over to paint the room. Adam picked out a beautiful color. He worked all day and all night to get the room done.
original_ending: Grandma was happy when she saw the job he had done.

endings.ending: To thank him she cooked him his favorite meal.
He told her he was finished and she said she had some yard work for him to do as well and smiled.
His grandma did not like color of the painting.
Finally, he get tired and get flu on the time.
Grandma shrieked in horror when she saw the bright pink walls.
Grandma hated the color and decided she wanted wallpaper instead.

story: Gina was supposed to go back to her classroom after an hour. She decided not to go back. As she decided to stay a wave of relief came over her. She felt as if a weight had been lifted from her shoulders.
original_ending: She went back to her classwork with a smile on her face.

endings.ending: she went back to class but regretted it.
her teacher praised her for coming back.
She got in trouble and was called to the principle's office.
Instead, she walked downtown to get some ice cream.
She realized that her relief came from a hatred of the course she was taking, and so she decided to withdraw from the course entirely and change her field of study.
After taking a moment to settle herself, she walked back to the classroom to find that the professor had dismissed the class early that day.

story: Jason went swimming at the neighborhood pool. He was throwing his splash ball across to a friend. The lifeguard warned him not to throw it so hard. He threw it hard and hit a little girl in the face.
original_ending: He was kicked out of the pool for the rest of the day.

endings.ending: He apologized and felt bad the rest of the day.
The girl's parent came up and yelled at Jason.
He felt awful and immediately checked on the girl and apologized to the girl and her parents.
The girl started crying as a joke and began laughing as soon as she saw the look of horror on Jason's face.
The little girl's mom came over and yelled at Jason.
Jason ran and hid behind the locker rooms.

story: Josh rode his bike to the park. He made a new friend while he was there. They played on the swings and slides for a long time. He was disappointed when his new friend had to go home.
original_ending: He rode home on his bike and told his mom about his new friend.

endings.ending: Josh rode home and eventually forgot about the kid he met at the park.
Josh followed the kid home to see where he lived.
As he was riding home, he noticed his friend was going the same way so they headed back together.
They decided to exchange phone numbers so they could hang out another time.
They exchanged phone numbers and said they would call each other.
They saw each other the next day when they were back at the park.

story: It was Veronica's first time on a plane. After checking in, she and her family were seated on the plane. The plane was about to take off, and Veronica was nervous. As the plane picked up speed, she closed her eyes.
original_ending: When she opened them again, they were high in the clouds.

endings.ending: She slept through most of the flight
Her family woke her up once they were in the clouds
The shaking and the noise of the plane taking off scared her and she started crying.
Eventually she realized it was no big deal, so she just enjoyed the flight without any problems and was never afraid again.
When the plane lifted off the ground she threw up all over herself and her family!
She ended up having a great time on the flight, and she decided that she was going to be a flight attendant when she was old enough.

story: Vince wanted to go to the party on Saturday night. His parents asked him to clean his room before he can go. Vince decided not to clean his room at all. His parents explained that he can't go to the party.
original_ending: Vince stayed home and cleaned his room on Saturday night.

endings.ending: He was upset, and snuck out anyway.
Vince was stubborn and threw a fit, saying they weren't being fair.
Vince waited until his parents fell asleep and then snuck out and went to the party anyway.
Vince was too embarrassed to call and cancel on his friends, so he changed his mind and begrudgingly cleaned.
Vince snuck out the window when his parents fell asleep.
Vince stayed home and pouted in anger all night.

story: A bus was driven by a mean old man. His name was Rick. Nobody liked him and he liked no one else. Rick stopped to pick up some people from the bus stop.
original_ending: He gave them a mean face causing the people to take the next bus.

endings.ending: He gestured to rush them in the door.
He yelled at a little kid who was taking too long to board the bus.
A very nice old lady gave him a cake for his birthday and she was the only one he was ever nice to.
He realized he'd had enough of doing a job he hated so he walked off the bus and went home.
But only one person wanted to take the bus.
Nobody wanted to get on the bus, so Rick stormed off.

story: After work, Marie plopped on a chair to watch her shows. She shooed away her kids, who wanted Marie to play with them. Marie turned the channel to one of her favorite programs. On the show, a mom was talking about how quickly kids grow up.
original_ending: Marie looked at her own kids and turned off the TV.

endings.ending: Marie listened with interest as the mom told her story.
Marie heard the kid's screaming and playing, and looked forward to the quieter days to come.
Marie changed the channel.
Marie thought to herself, "Ha, I wish."
Marie didn't think much of it and continued on with her show.
Marie felt bad so she asked the kids if they wanted to watch television with her.

story: Elizabeth was reading when she heard a loud crash. The front window was smashed in, and a baseball lay on the carpet. She opened the front door and saw a boy in her yard. She scolded him for breaking the window.
original_ending: He had a guilty look on his face, but he lied and said it wasn't him.

endings.ending: He started crying but Elizabeth was not ready to forgive him.
When she turned back the window was magically repaired and she couldn't believe her eyes.
The boy began to cry and Elizabeth began to regret her rancor.
The boy grabbed his bat and ran at Elizabeth; she closed the door just before she was assaulted.
He started crying and apologizing, and Elizabeth felt bad for scolding him.
He took one look at her and sprinted away down the street until Elizabeth could not see him anymore.

story: Lily was getting ready for Halloween. She was dressing up as a princess. Just before it was time to go, her mom gave her a gift. It was a really nice tiara for her costume.
original_ending: Lily thanked her mom and then put the tiara on.

endings.ending: Lily had no idea the tiara was actually worth a million dollars.
Lily hated it and refused to go out wearing the tiara.
When night came, a terrible storm blew in and Lily didn't get to trick or treat at all.
When Lily went out, she saw all her friends were wearing the same costume and she felt silly.
When she was trick or treating, however, a mean girl stole it.
She looked at herself in the mirror and she looked just like Cinderella!

story: Joey and Missy were traveling on a bus. They had stopped one evening for a gas fill up. While they waited, they decided to buy some fries. They were waiting for the fries when the bus began to board.
original_ending: Luckily, the fries were ready just in time for them to board.

endings.ending: they had to leave the potatoes and board the bus.
they asked the driver to wait and he waited.
They had to leave their delicious hot fries behind, and they cried about it all the way home.
The fries were ready on time, but they had to smuggle them on board, and Joey got a huge grease stain on his jacket.
They lost the potato and almost missed the bus.
Missy took the potato while Joey told the driver to hold on.

story: Mark had to make a movie for his film class. He asked three of his friends to come act in his film. The day of the shoot, Mark went to the location. He waited for his friends, but no one showed up.
original_ending: Mark was sad that he could not make his film.

endings.ending: Mark filmed the movie by himself and played every part.
Mark dropped out of film class in frustration.
Nonetheless he filmed alone, changing the plot, and the teacher gave him the max grade.
A girl passing through asked him if he needed any help, and she became the main subject of the film.
He then made a movie with three strangers who later became his friends.
He later found out that they met with an accident.

story: John woke up with a tickle in his throat. John worried he was coming down with a cold. He downed two glasses of orange juice and took a vitamin. Later that day, John went to the doctor.
original_ending: There, John learned that he did in fact have a nasty cold.

endings.ending: The doctor told him that it was just allergies and that he would be fine.
The doctor told him that his tonsils were infected and needed to be removed.
His doctor said he was fine but told him he should close his windows at night.
His doctor said he actually had the flu.
It turned out he only had a minor cold, but it was a good thing he went to the doctor because the doctor discovered a strange lump in John's thyroid that needed further testing.
He wound up vomiting in the doctor's office.

story: Jen loved to study for a big test sitting on her bed with her book. Jen has to stop and pick up her dog to put her on the bed. The dog is too little to jump that high by herself and she cries. So Jen finds a footstool that the dog can use to jump up on the bed.
original_ending: Now the dog can jump up and down using the foot stool.

endings.ending: Her dog winds up getting a little knock to the head as the footstool topples over.
The dog winds up being scared of the footstool, though, and refuses to go near it.
Eventually the dog grew and no longer needed the foot stool to climb into bed.
From using the footstool so much it ended up breaking and Jen had to buy a new one for the dog.
The dog was stubborn and refused to use the stool.
The cat uses it as well, so both the animals were on the bed.

story: Janet was very excited that it was Christmas so she could open gifts. She raced downstairs to take a look at the presents under the tree. To her delight, there were a dozen gifts with her name on them. Janet immediately opened every gift she could get her hands on.
original_ending: She was thrilled that she got everything she asked for the holidays.

endings.ending: All of her gifts were clothes and other things that she didn't want, and she was very disappointed.
Her parents had played a joke on her, and all the gifts were chunks of coal and they spent all day laughing about it.
She liked a few of the gifts, but was saddened that the one she had hoped for the most wasn't there.
After that, her parents gave her the best present of all...a new puppy!
Janet's parents laughed when they watched the video of Janet opening empty boxes with no presents in them.
Janet spent the next hour trying on clothes and looking at herself in the mirror.

story: Jennifer was at the store. She had a bunch of coupons and her list was built around them. She spent nearly an hour clearing her cart. At check out, she learned that her coupons had expired.
original_ending: Her entire plan was ruined and she had to put the food back.

endings.ending: She showed the expired coupons to the cashier, and the cashier honored the coupons.
Jennifer then decided to pay for all the food she had in her cart with her credit card instead of cash.
She needed the food so she bought them at full price.
She decided to pick through what she absolutely needed and bought just that.
but the manager helped her out by providing an extension on the expiry date of coupons with some fee.
As a token of good heart the cashier offered her a large discount on some products, so she ended up buying a few products with cash.

story: Tim had a dog that was a black lab. Tim's friend was a local dog whisperer. Tim's friend informed him that his dog needed to run more. Tim decided to take up running.
original_ending: Tim began running with the dog and they both began to feel happier.

endings.ending: He hired a dog walker to run with his dog.
Then, he bought a treadmill for his dog.
Tim could not keep up with his lab and the leash pulled him forward and he got injured in a fall.
Tim decided running was not for him so he took his dog to the dog park to run.
Tim chose the local park for them to run together.
Tim looked online for dog shoes to prevent burns from the hot pavement.

story: Last week my friends and I got sleds together and went on a hill. We all had races going down and running back up. I won most of them but it was almost a tie. My best friend finally gave up when he was too tired.
original_ending: It was a fun day and we all felt like winners.

endings.ending: He never wanted to hang out with me again.
We went back to the igloo, lit a fire, and went to sleep.
I was very happy as we enjoyed a lot after so many months.
Then we went back to hotel to have some food.
My friend was angry he lost and would not talk to me.
I decided to do a victory dance.

story: Amy wanted to learn how to draw. She asked her mother to show her to draw a woman. She practiced drawing for a week before giving up. She went to the kitchen for a snack.
original_ending: Her face lit up when she saw her drawings were on the fridge.

endings.ending: She decided to try drawing again and this time she was successful!
Her mom was there and showed her how to draw something else.
She would spend the rest of her life turning to food to cope with failure.
She realized she had been drawing with the wrong hand.
While she ate she thought: drawing is not for everyone.
She ate and gave up giving up.

story: It was Sara's turn to let the dog outside. Sara opened the front door and let the dog run out. A couple hours later Sara remembered the dog and went to let him in. She noticed the gate was open and her dog was missing.
original_ending: Sara rushed to tell her mom that the dog was missing.

endings.ending: Sara felt so bad, she ran away from home.
Sara started calling his name, and her dog came running toward her from behind the garage!
Sara found the dog playing with the neighbor's dog next door.
Sara's dog was hit by a car, but thankfully they got him to the vet on time so they could save him.
She put up flyers all over the neighborhood, and eventually someone called to say they'd found the dog.
She never saw her dog again.

story: I married a girl that I also work with. I thought it would be fun to see her all day every day. Soon I noticed that all our conversations were about work stuff. I asked her if we could talk about other topics when we are at home.
original_ending: She agreed that's a good idea and now we are much happier.

endings.ending: She told me she was going to be busy with work and we could talk about other topics another time.
When we got home my wife and I discussed our relationship with her, and told her I wanted to go on a second honeymoon.
It caused a big fight and we are now living seperately.
She then asked if we could discuss when we are having children instead.
She was such a workaholic that she just couldn't resist talking about work all the time, which eventually ruined our marriage.
She thought that it would be better if we got separate jobs.

story: A friend told me Lime juice plus Kool Aid taste really good. I did not believe him but asked for the recipe anyway. He gave me me the same recipe that was on back of the Kool Aid package. My friend just add lime juice to the Koolaid recipe.
original_ending: I made the recipe and discovered lime juice Kool Aid really is good.

endings.ending: It was that day that I discovered I was allergic to lime juice and had to go to the hospital.
The juice was so good I made my parents try it and now we have it once a week.
When I made the recipe I found that it didn't suit my taste and I never used Kool Aid lime juice again.
When I tried to make the recipe I ended up making a mistake and it didn't turn out very good, I'll try again another time.
I guess I forgot to add the sugar in because it was so sour my mouth puckered.
Upon tasting the concoction, I realized my friend was sadly wrong.

story: Karen's grandmother gave her two gifts for Christmas. One was a videogame that she really liked. The other was twenty dollars to give to another person or charity. Karen thought very hard about what to do with the money.
original_ending: She donated it to a group that bought books for poor children.

endings.ending: She decided to give it to a girl in one of her classes that was poor and hadn't gotten any gifts for Christmas.
In the end she disregarded what her grandmother had asked her to do, and instead spent the money on another videogame for herself.
Karen decided to keep the money for herself and lie about who she gave it to.
Karen ended up losing the twenty dollars before she could give it away.
Karen chose to donate the money to Ukraine people and her grandmother was happy and bought her another videogame.
Karen lied to her grandmother, she bought snacks using that money instead, her grandmother was angry knowing that.
